So this place is SO F'n good that when I went it was TOO BUSY!  My service was not good but after talking to management, I discovered they were down on staff for this reason or that.  Our bill was reducted by 50% for the inconvenience!  I can't say enough about the customer service!  Stellar!  The food, well that speaks for itself.
Even though my experience wasn't the best the 1st time around, they made it right and I WILL BE BACK!  I give this joint 2 thumbs high up in the air!!

This place is in our regular restaurant rotation and I have yet to find something I don't like here! 
The Peppered Steak pasty is my favorite but I also LOVE the Chicken Greek, Carne Adovada and Pesto Chicken. If your not in the mood for a pasty, even their salads are spot on. Don't leave without having the Banoffee Pie or PB&J pasty. Your taste buds will explode!
Food was really good. However, the service left some to be desired. Our drinks were empty for 3/4 of our meal and only when we asked for them to be filled, was it done.

I drank the 34oz pitcher of Hoegarden by myself. Like a boss. The only challenge was actually LIFTING the 34oz pitcher.... which was a struggle.

I liked Cornish Pasty Co because its simple: pastys, beer and a couple of sides. No worries if you're vegetarian or pescatarian or whatever the hell you're in to these days (seriously people!)  they have every kind of pasty you want, and all delicious.

I got the sheppard's pie with the traditional fillings (mash potatoes, gound beef, peas and carrots) and gravy dipping sauce.  

Mmmmmmm, the delicious taste of an English heart attack.

The pasty was decent in size (filling enough for a whole meal for sure), came piping hot and had great flavor. The gravy dipping sauce was the best and they should probably put waaaaay more of it on your plate than the small cup you get with your pasty. Add some side orders of their chips (garlic and jalapeno please) and you've got yourself a manly meal. 

For those into decor: this place has it. Very simple style, candle-lit and long tables, almost picnic-style. Easy, simple, down to earth. I don't need more than that.

5 stars all around. Did I mention that I finished my 34oz pitcher of Hoegarden? Like a Boss? Really, I did.

We preferred the more traditional meat and cheese pasty  to the chicken tiki pasty. Both are good but the mustard sauce and gravy that come with the meat n cheese are an absolutely the perfect compliment to the cheesy, flaky pasty.  Tried and true comfort food combinations.  Love the flavors and the red wine gravy is indeed very tasty.

My husband is a big eater.  He recommends getting one or two sides if your hungry and want to fill up ( I was fine with just a pasty).
SO love this place. I used to visit their location in Tempe from time to time, but now I'm a bit south of there and decided to try another location. And you know what? Still just as fantastic.

Great little place, great food too. Between the tattoo and piercing-ridden staff and the interesting decor, this place reminds me of 'back home'. It really looks like a spot I would have enjoyed going to in the Park Ave. area of Rochester, NY. The place has some communal seating (complete with vintage church pews as benches) and also an outdoor area for people who can't get enough of the heat (or like to smoke, I suppose).

The menu is vast - I was amazed at all the different pasty options I had. I do wish they had the traditional without rutabega, but I settled on one with beef, cheddar and potatoes instead. It was moist and flavorful and the crust was perfect. I know what a "real" pasty is and although these are slightly different than what I'm used to, they are definitely worth it.

One thing to note - thought not surprising - their beer selection is not run of the mill. I asked for a Bud Light and the server looked at me like I was from outer space. After she helpfully pointed out the options on their beer menu (with offerings from mostly European breweries) I had the opportunity to try something new, and I was happy for it.

I just moved here from SD and this is the first place Ive found with the slightest hint of authenticity or originality.

The servers are tastefully rude in a way that is amusing and contributes to the dark atmosphere. Everything inside is dark, old, and antiquely, which together with the black and white gothic portraits an candlestick lighting makes you feel like you're in an alfred hitchcock movie.

The food is outstanding. I had some kind of mexican food pasty and every bite was delicious. If you've never been here and are a fan of anything alternative or outside of the box, I highly recommend you try this restaurant.

I dream about the red wine gravy.  I love that there are so many options...but I always go with the original pasty.  The meatball appetizer is INSANELY delicious.  I wish there was a pasty filled with it!!!

Hot vegan chicken pasty with 32 oz Guinness and Smithwicks aka Blacksmith.   The chicken is made of portobello mushrooms that are excellent.   

With 50s and 60s music playing in the background made the evening out excellent.   We will be back!

We were staying at a local hotel and looking for a place where we could dine outside on the patio with our Golden Retriever.  A friend who lives nearby told us about Cornish Pasty. We had no idea what a pasty was but looking at the menu online and it looked interesting. We were not disappointed. Both of our pasties were superb. We will be back in AZ next week and plan on dining here again. Wish they had these in Southern California.

Really fantastic English pub fare and a great beer list. I'm always looking for some good craft or international beers, and this place did the trick. Bartender was knowledgeable and service was quick. The tandoori chicken wings were the bomb.com, as was the baked cheesy broccoli cauliflower, and just about everything we had. Looking for some decent British pub fare, and good dranks? Look no more. Also- they use the Ballast Point bloody Mary Mix- big props for that!
I tried the bangers and mash pasty, it came with gravy and tasted very tasty! I also had the sticky toffee bread pudding which was amazing, my favorite!

LOVE THIS PLACE! If your in Tempe and are looking for some good food you need to go here. They never disappoint with their service or food! It's a cute little place with a large menu with options for everyone. They sell basically high class calzones each with their own unique dipping sauce. The only complaint I have is the restaurant is very dark. It's hard to see since there is very little lighting. Other than that 10/10 would recommend!

First time here and was not disappointed. They hand make their pasties fresh. I ordered the original Oggie and took hall home. It came with a delightful red wine sauce and my server gave me a fresh container to take with my leftovers. Servers all worked as a team whether it was refilling drinks or bringing out food. 

My friend ordered the potato and leek soup which came with two large slices of homemade white bread. Very tasty. 

I would definitely come back and try more items on the menu!!

Oh Cornish Pasty Company... your acoustics aren't great and your tables do need a bit of cleaning but your food is so delicious I see and hear nothing else. The bangers and mash pasty coupled with a side of mushy pea is quite possibly the best thing I've ever had. Top it off with great service and a beautiful atmosphere and I'm in love. I have heard that they are opening a location in Vegas and implore anyone from management reading to open a Tucson location!
A+ as always! $3.00 Irish car bombs... Can't beat that, plus the awesome food! Been going here for years!

Went with my family expecting great things based on comments from friends. The place was dark and loud with extremely slow service. The food was carb-loaded and dry. I am at an utter loss as to why this place seems to have an almost cult-like following. I did like my beer, and I see beer routinely mentioned in these favorable reviews (insert glowing "I love you, man" restaurant review here). Really thinking I ought to give this place a second try if for no other reason than I trust my friends' opinions and might have just had a random bad experience.

I have a friend who might as well live here, so when he suggested that we meet him I was curious to see why. As it turns out, it might be because of their alcohol options as opposed to their food options. 

The soup options looked tasty, so I went for one while we waited for our friend to show. I ordered the leek soup. The soup itself was nearly a revalation, but I was not a fan of the bread. I love bread, so this was a little sad for me. The soup was creamy, had just the right amount of cheese, and somehow managed to not be overly leeky. Five stars on soup.

There was an impressive amount of beer options, according to my husband.

I ordered The Pilgrim. The dough was delicious, as was the turkey. I could have done without the large slices of onion and par-cooked yams (which didn't taste very "Thanksgiving" to me anyway). When I caught a bit of stuffing it made me very happy. I didn't like the gravy, but didn't need it anyway as the pasty was not dry. There was also a side of cranberry relish. I ate it all and took an additional cup home for my left overs (the soup was filling).

The second half of my pasty came home and spent the night in our fridge. It was far better having rested there for the evening. I was impressed with how much more I liked the pasty on day 2.  Four stars on pasty alone.

Seating indoors was strange, not suited for a couple having a dinner date, but ok for drinks. Seems as if though the bench-seating and dark atmosphere would be cool for pre-game drinking, perhaps with a large group of friends. It was slow when we were there, which I understand may be uncommon.

I'm a huge fan of this place. My wife and best friend are as well. My favorite pasty so far is the peppered steak and I love me some four peaks oatmeal stout. Friendly service and a fun atmosphere make this a great place to feed my face and get my buzz on. Highly recommended

What a FANTASTIC find!  My first trip to Ireland was earlier this year, and I've been craving pasties ever since.  After a random Google search, I found this place..followed by a quick lookup of reviews on Yelp.  Let me tell you, the excellent reviews on Yelp are spot on!

Today was my first visit.  I ordered 2 pasties for pickup during my lunch hour, as I figured I'd eat half of each one and save the rest for dinner(IF it was any good).  I got the Cheese Steak(10 out of 10) and the Shepherd's Pie(8 out of 10).  After a 15 minute drive back to work, they were still piping hot!  And the taste absolutely blew me away.  The Cheese Steak was PHENOMENAL....it will be hard not to order that the next few times I go, but eventually I'd like to try the many other creations they have.

I've heard their Happy Hour is fantastic, so I intend on rounding up some friends to check that out sometime soon!

Food is crazy good, here. Authentic, and also some with a twist. 

Fantastic place to take friends for fun! Pricepoint is wonderful, and the atmosphere is casual. Staff is very friendly. Love  you guys!

Believe the hype.  This place is great!  I take every visitor we have to Cornish Pasty.  I have been here almost 10 times now and I am still finding new favorites on the menu.  All the Pasty's are awesome.  Even the pasta salad is great.  Great place!
It's really frustrating that I've never actually been able to try the pasties I want because they're always sold out. You shouldn't be sold out of half your menu at 5:30pm. This is poor management.

Back for 3rd time. 3rd time is charm. Had the peppered steak pasty. The crust was golden brown, flaky and light. When dipped in sauce, it was delicious. The vegetables were fresh tasting. The steak hard to find, was enjoyable. This Pasty also benefited from extra bleu cheese added. Thanks for reading. The Bike Chaplain
By far my new favorite go to. The vibe is great, the service was great. Don't think you would regret anything off the menu. Can't wait to go back!

I've about given up finding anything outstanding in this area. Why is everything so highly rated but yet not really that good? My pasty was dry and had so much pepper I could not taste any of the ingredients.

I can't describe to you how amazing these gourmet adult hot pockets taste! They literally MELT in your mouth- a few of my favorites are the Cajun Chicken, Dill Salmon, and the Stilton & Steak---Bon Appetit everyone! And don't forget about the all day everyday-$3 car bombs(you can't beat that price) their happy hour is amazing, too!

Awesome meals! I've never tried before this kind of food and it's delicious. I went with my family (4 people), each one asked a different dish and everyone was really satisfied. Great service, fair prices and awesome food... !! And don't forget the desserts!!!!

When I use to work in London, I always looked forward to having a pint at the end of the day with my friends. 

Besides their incredible food, Cornish Pasty has the feel that reminds me very much of an English pub. The food is the real star here, but the beers they have on tap are outstanding. 

One of my favorite, is the north London brewer Fuller's Extra Special Bitter(ESB). It's fresh, tasty and took me back to the City pubs of my youth. Granted the beer back then was warmer. LOL

As we sat waiting for our server, you could see everyone was happy to be here. We sat near the bar, to the right of where the cooks are preparing the meals. Pretty soon all those dozen or so bar stools were taken. There was a lot of laughing. Folks being happy at the end of the work week and enjoying each others company. What a great atmosphere!

We started with the 20 oz/ pint of the Fuller's ($6.00) that I mentioned (photo) and glass of the Leitz Out ($6.50) Riesling. Both hit the spot nicely. 

For dinner we ordered the Bangers and Mash pasty, along with the Rosemary Chicken pasty and shared some English Oven garlic chips ($3.50). I believe the chicken might have been the better of the two pasty, but not by much!

Both, had a sophisticate layering of flavors, that were subtle and very nice.  In the hands of a different Chef, you could see how the flavors might have overwhelm the palette. But not here. Surprising they were only $9.00 each. Incredible. 

For dessert, we shared the Chocolate Bread Pudding ($6.00) and the Apple Carmel Pasty ($5.00). Both were also delicious. 

Each of the above items were very filling. We couldn't finish them, or the desserts. So we had four "to go" boxes for later. I've posted several pictures and we really had a fun time.  Our bill came to a fair $49.07 including taxes, but before gratuities. 

We'll be back. Enjoy!

There must be something special to this place when a surgeon after seeing him tells you to go have something wonderful and be bad before I have surgery. This is my first time here and it's early so it's not crowded yet but it smells wonderful inside the diner room. I was seated right away and the waitress came and went over the menu with me she had a good knowledge of the menu which is nice. I have had English food in the pubs in London and all over England so we'll see how this meets English standards.  OMG my lunch was so good!!!!!!!.my pastry melted in my mouth.  It was filled to the brim with steak potatoes  and mushrooms.   Will i be back? yes,yes,yes
This is the first stop in Arizona and what a surprise. I tried the Greek pasty which was delicious with tzatziki sauce on the side. Great beer selection. Sit outside and enjoy the weather!

Very good for a great price AND a variety of vegetarian selections! I was excited, my BF took me here for my b-day and we were not disappointed. I could only eat half of my pasty and so we skipped desert. Beers were reasonably priced too. 
We will be back but I am afraid my kids would be scared "everything is touching" eeekkk!

Had a wonderful time with my girlfriend! Staff was very friendly especially the cook Kyle. We had a great time talking with him and watching him cook as we ate. Food was amazing and beer selection was awesome! 10/10 we will be back

Food is great. Ambiance is awesome. Lot to do if you're waiting for your food. They have a pool table,  dart board. Good collection of beers if you just want to seat and drink. A lot of options for vegetarians as well. Veggie chicken tikka is my fav.

I can't believe I waited this long to write a review. I have been to the Cornish a dozen times and love it more with each experience. You can go for just a beer, car bomb, or their tasty pasty. A a cold Rogue and switch it up between the Greek (w/chicken) or the Carne Adovada. 

Trust me once you have it you will always crave it. I went to Germany for 7 months and all my friends would tell me I just had or about to have a pasty. Well this is the one place I missed from home. 

Thanks for having multiple locations! Maybe one is Scottsdale is to come?!! 

PS their staff rocks!

Our first experience with Cornish pastys. I have to admit we were both dubious enough that we briefly considered going elsewhere when we found out we couldn't customize our orders because the pastys are premade and partially cooked as it takes an hour to cook one from start to finish. 

The ambiance was cool with a flavor of Britain - long communal tables, dark wood interior and bars to belly up to. Definitely doesn't feel like you're in Arizona anymore! We had instantly been transported to a pub in England.  

The quality of food was extremely high. I won't tell you everything we ordered because we will sound like gluttons, but I will say we took home leftovers from every dish because the the portions are ample. 

My husband had the oggie and I had the Mexican. Both were very good but my husband said he would order mine next time. The prices were very reasonable! We were shocked at how low our bill was and how many leftovers we had. 


All in all, worth the visit. We look forward to bringing friends and family back to enjoy this unique and flavorful spot!

My hiking friend and I stopped here after a weekend hiking in the white mountains. The pasty menu is very extensive, so it took some time in choosing which one to get. 

I finally decided on the peppered steak. The server asked me if i was OK with Stilton cheese (similar to blue), and I assured her that was fine. The pasty was very tasty, with numerous slices of tender steak, caramelized onions, portobello mushrooms and zucchini. The aforementioned cheese was just the right amount. I also looked the side of brandy  peppercorn cream sauce. 

The service was a bit slow, but other than that, it was a great find. I'll definitely add this to my list of places to eat when I'm ever back in the valley of the sun.

Great, different, fun place to go.  Church pew seating inside..sometime share with other people (no problem) or outside seating.  If you like something different, give it a try!  Great dinner and unusual beers to choose from.  I had Chicken Greek and it was terrific.  Others had Shepherd's Pie, Pilgrim, Steak and potatoes and everyone liked theirs. Kind of loud which we enjoyed, but if looking for nice quiet place, this is not it.  All tables had candles melted into liquor bottles.  Fun and good!

Cornish Pasty has a very strong English pub atmosphere, accentuated by its industrial stools and wooden benches.  The best way to describe a pasty is a gourmet hot pocket.   The fillings come in all types from traditional lamb and mint to the southwestern influence of chiptole chicken.  I had the lamb and mint pasty, comprised of chunky pieces of lamb, carrots, and potatoes, with the aroma of fresh mint.  This is their specialty.  Another one I tried was their Shepard's pie.  This is a traditional Shepard's pie incased in a flaky crust.  The filling is minced lamb meat with herbs and spices mixed with mashed potatoes.  Each individual ingredient didn't seem all that special, but mixed together, it created a masterpiece in my mouth.  The flavors blended well together.  I also ordered their "chips" (french fries for us Americans).  They cut baked potato wedges which are great for the health-conscience people.  It's seasoned with sauted garlic and parmesan cheese.  The seasoning wasn't too stron.g  It gave the potato a subtle garlic flavor unlike some other restaurant which over-season their fries. 
 
Come to this bloody good restaurant to experience a casual British pub without the price of a plane ticket.

We went to Cornish Pasty for the first time last Friday with two other couples from our neighborhood.  My husband and I had the Oggie.  We both liked it.  The meat inside was very tender and moist.  We also had a Greek side salad and tried the Chocolate Bread Pudding for dessert with ice cream.  All the food if very good.  
The atmosphere however was distressing.  It was so dark that we had to use a flash light to read the menus. Luckily one of the men in our group had a small flash light in his pocket.  (He has dined here before.)  It was very noisy with loud music and talking so that we could barely carry on a conversation.  Is there ever a quieter time here?  I think next time we'll just do take out.
The place was crowded with 30 somethings so they must not mind the dark and noise.

Delicious. We had the vegetarian Oggie, chicken pesto pasty, cottage pie pasty, and broccoli cauliflower bake.  The pasty crust is well done, no undercooked spots, flaky but not greasy. The filings were generous. We ordered take out and waited at the bar. The bartenders were great, they kept a lookout for our order,  gave good info on the many beers they carry. The Papago brewing Orange Blossom ale is great. And they have a lot of good things on draft. Overall a great take out experience; food was still warm when we got home. Good job Dobson location!
I love the food - lots of different varieties! Atmosphere is nice and laid back. I love coming here!

Wow!  This place was great!!  First off let me say there are so many choices of Pasties on the menu it is hard to decide.  I went in torn between the Greek and the Cottage Pie.  I went with the cottage Pie and an order of their chips.  The cottage pie was fantasic!!  The wine gravy was out of this world.  As for the chips, YUM!  The waitress was a sweetheart.  The music was just the volume.  Lot's beers to choose from if your a drinker.  Highly recommend.

My fiancee grew up eating pasties in England that his grandmother made and he hadn't had anything like it  in many years, so we decided to try Cornish Pasty Co.  Nice, quaint atmosphere, roomy seating, great beer selection.  When our food arrived, I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious it was, especially the gravy.  More importantly, my fiancee was over the moon at how the crust tasted "just like Nan's" .  We will definitely come back again.

Chandler location: Gave me so much indigestion I thought I was going to die. It took 60 minutes to receive my order. 

Phoenix location: took 80 minutes to receive any of the items our table ordered. Large chicken bone stabbed my cousin right under the tongue. Gnarly puncture wound. Meal was comped, still would never go back.

Awesome British food:Yes 
Relaxed atmosphere: Yup
Hot waiter: Oh, Yeah
The food here is pretty good. Our host Hannah was also real lovely, thumbs up to her!!! We will definitely be going back here.

Yum!  Yum!  Yum!

I went with a friend for dinner on a Wednesday night and the restaurant was fairly crowded.  She got some Thanksgiving Turkey pasty with stuffing, gravy and cranberry sauce on the side.  She said it was wonderful.  As a vegetarian there was a whole page of choices!!  I went with the Mock Rosemary Chicken one the waitress recommended.  I really liked it... mock chicken, brie cheese, mushrooms, potatoes, roasted red peppers and a sweet mustard sauce on the side.

It was so filling that I couldn't even finish it.  Which is a bit of a bummer because I wanted one of the delish sounding desserts so bad.  I must make a special trip some night soon just for dessert.

The atmosphere was trendy, fun and friendly.  The service was GREAT.  The food was cheap and as good as it gets.

What took me so long to finally try this place?  I can't wait to go back.

we are obsessed with this place, and come here once a week, usually late weekend night. The food is delicious, and their beer selection is awesome.

We usually start out with the tandoori wings[ spicy, but to me everything lately is], with a badass dipping sauce, then we go for the pasties.My favorite are the salmon one and the rosemary chicken and brie.

My guy usually goes for the traditional guiness stew or bangers and mash.

yum.yum.yum.

Very casual place, can get very loud on weekends.

Dare I say it... This might be my favorite pasty location yet! I came here with my date the other night and I loved the ambiance of the inside. I ordered be leek soup with bread and it was divine. They also have beer specials each night, on Thursday it was dollar off bottles and cans! Their patio a decent size but the inside is where it's at! 

Will definitely be back.

I kept seeing this place on Yelp and had to try it, I will say I loved the pasty I had (Turkey & cranberry).

Overall I was very happy with my meal with the exception that there were no sides offered with it.  Fries, chips, cole slaw, something!

Worth checking out for sure.
I really enjoy eating here.  The food and drinks are always delicious, and have yet to disappoint.  The service is a bit slow but super friendly and super accommodating.  Look forward to returning.

Ok so I'm not big on trying new things. I try new things but I'm always afraid I won't like it. I guess you can say I am an adventure but in denial!  Hehe. Ok so my boyfriend loves loves to try anything.  First time I cam here I got a ceaser ckn salad and it was awesome I will say. Second time we came here his sister was in town with her boyfriend from Massachusetts visiting. Beer is awesome so I hear from my boyfriend and his sis and her boyfriend. I like wheat beers so I'm picky. But I won't say the beer isn't good just because I am a selective person. Ok so we all got pastes I got a salmon asparagus one and I can't remember what everyone else got but I will def say there was no complaints coming from anyone! I am normally good at not over stuffing myself but this was to good to pass up! Haha. Service was great! Was sat immediately maybe a min for them to get our drinks which was great! No complaints here. Dont eat to much you come here or your missing out on the pastes!

I've never had a bad experience at the Cornish Pasty company. Actually, I always leave happily full and slightly buzzed. 

The Cornish Pasty company is definitely a hipster place. Very dark inside the with wax candles and techno music. Lots of beards and man buns found here but the staff is always warm and very friendly. 

The food is decent but heavy. A Cornish Pasty is basically a large pastry filled with meats and cheeses usually accompanied by a cold, refreshing beer. Reminds me a lot of my European study abroad. Sometimes, during the Arizona summers, I feel like the food is overwhelmingly heavy.

I actually like the beers and ciders better than the actual food. They always have something different in tap every time I come. I like it. 

I definitely recommend this place.

Excellent server!  He won us over, especially with the Boston accent.  We split a Shepherd's Pie and Mexican pasty - both were out of this world!  Cleaned our plates and finished it off with the server's recommendation of sticky toffee pudding with 1+ shot of Jameson poured on top!  Way better than a Thanksgiving dinner!

This is an experience worth going. I had  the veggie cottage pie, my husband had the chicken pot pie pasty. The crust is very flaky and holds up to the filling. We were all happy with our meat/veggie pies and drinks. I had a drink called Ghost something or other and it tasted like a big White Russian. Very tasty food and drink.

A go to place for a filling, warm and delicious meal! When you think pasty you might just think of the traditional meat and potatoes, but this spot offers SO much more. Being a non meat eater I enjoy their long list of vegetarian pasty options. I have pretty much tried them all and there is not one that I do not like. 

If I had to give my favorites they would be: Veggie Spicy Asiago, Veggie Rosemary & Veggie Pesto. All equally delicious! 

The restaurant itself definitely has a hipster vibe- dark, wine bottles with candle wax dripping down the side, old church pews as table benches. They also have a large outdoor patio. 

Don't have time for a sit down meal? Call in your order to go. They will either cook them hot and ready to eat or half bake them and you can pop them in your oven at home to eat when you are ready. 

For take out, dine in or a late night bite and a beer this place is a must!
Their vegan vindaloo pasty is amazing.  Every day that have two vegan options... great atmosphere, food, and service.

I visited Cornish Pasty 2-3 weeks ago. It was my second time eating at this location. The food is always fantastic, but the service was particularly spot-on, too. Our waitress (wish I could remember her name) was great about checking in and always making sure our water glasses were full without being intrusive. It was honestly some of the best restaurant service I've ever had. I had the chicken pesto pasty, and my husband had the royale with cheese pasty. I can't wait to come back and try more of their menu.

Absolutely delicious food completely outdone by the most disturbingly disgusting interior ever!  I've always eaten outside before, and had I never done inside, this would have been a five-star review.  However, the last time I went,  it was so hot out that we decided to eat inside.  I sat at the bar area where you could see the kitchen.  The floor appears to have NEVER been cleaned, there was garbage everywhere, and I watched employees scraping food leftovers, crumbs, etc. onto the floor and leaving it there.  I also observed an employee with bare hands reach into a bucket that was setting on a cart and toss a handful of some kind of meat from the bucket onto a salad.  The bucket was not refrigerated and had sat there for who knows how long.  I was so appalled that not only did we not order any food, we actually left our alcohol behind.  The glass ware was dirty, the silverware was filthy, and the place was just an outright mess.  I have to give 2 stars at least because I know the food tastes really good, but I'd never be able to eat here again after seeing these conditions.  The owner should be seriously ashamed.

I stopped in earlier this month with a friend. We went on a Tuesday night, and almost completely had the place to ourselves. That was OK  as we were able to chat without yelling @ each other, and were able to chat a little bit with Heidi. Great gal...very friendly service. I ordered the Oggie (The Traditional Pasty), mushy peas (mainly after gauging my friend's expression of comfort to see them on the menu...childhood memories no doubt), and chips (potato wedges). I wasn't overwhelmed by the food. However, is English food ever overwhelming?. The pasty was a little dry and the wine gravy takes some getting used to. Although the beef was lean, it wasn't too tender. I can't say I'd recommend on the food, but the Strongbow Cider and the Hoegaarden were both pretty good. Also stuck around to play some Cricket @ the dartboard, which probably wouldn't have normally been available. I think it seems like a good place to have some drinks with friends, and soak up a good crowd atmosphere on a busier night.
This place is right by my house and has an excellent beer selection and the food is amazing. The ambience is also pretty good it's low-lit and Candlelight.

One of my places I take friends and family. Never disappointed went with 6 other ppl to drink play pool and hang out . only my wife and I were hungry. I ordered the meat and cheese she had the pasta salad , our friends were not hungry i'll say again so I went ahead and ordered oven chips and garlic roasted potatoes and had them put in front of them . My pasty was so moist and so scrumptious I was blown away . Wife had help from our friends finishing hers. As for the oven chips and potatoes they disappeared. Top notch service from Eric the bartender whom was swamped but managed to keep our drinks full our friends happy and me very content as I count on this place when entertaining friends. I'm just sorry I can only give you guys 5 stars. Thx again love Tim and Peggy
Heard about this place through a friend. Great atmosphere and amazing food.  Can't wait to go back.

My 1st experience here.  Unfortunately, I had the breakfast pasty and didn't particularly enjoy the way the flavours mixed.  I would certainly give the place one more chance and try a different pasty.  Other than my disappointing menu choice, the service was average, the ambience was cool and unique.  Prices were reasonable.

Love love love!

Haven't had a pasty I didn't like from this place!

Pros:
-Great/friendly staff
-Lots of good options to explore on the menu (including vegetarian options)
-Nice variety of beers and decent  happy hour specials
-Fun/down-to-earth feel

Cons:
-You essentially seat yourself, which can get tricky if you're going with a large group. The staff is usually accommodating, though, and will try to find space to fit your entire party.
-I don't believe you can really "customize" your pasty (i.e. switching the type of meats)

My favorite is the Royale with Cheese. Get it with the both homemade BBQ sauce AND the thousand island sauce. It's basically a cheeseburger in pasty form and it's oh so good. Another favorite is the Pilgrim--sweet potatoes, chicken/turkey, and you HAVE to get it with the side of cranberry sauce. Delicious.

I've been making and eating pasty all my life. The majority of my family comes from Cornwall. The pasties we make are nowhere near as good as the ones they make. Do yourself a favor and get one as soon as you can.

Great atmosphere, good quality food, and a decent selection of beers. We went there for lunch, and were not disappointed. The layout of the restaurant is unique, the pasties are a pretty filling and tasty, and the service was prompt and efficient. Oh, and the mushroom spinach soup was delicious!

Yelpers seem to love it. Place was packed on Friday night. Service was good. 

I had Bangers snd Mash pasty. My wife had pepper steak pasty. Red wine sauce was tasty.  Both were good. 

My problem is that the food and service was good. Not great. Good enough to take leftovers home, but not good enough to return. Average, at best.
This place is amazing. Not sure what else to say, if you haven't been, you should go.

Good laid back vibe with people flying around hitting timers and taking food out of ovens.  Those pastys are good, and the variety is amazing.  Dog Fish Head on tap is a plus as well.  To quote the infamous Governor of California " I will be back."
The temperature of my meatballs and pasty were questionable, I ate them despite being cold and like warm. I told the server, she said that is out of the norm. Won't be back here.

Everything is good here, great place to stop by for lunch or dinner. So many different pasties. Would love to try them all!

Great beer selection, too.

It is permanently in our rotation of restaurants to eat at when in Phoenix area for annual spring training trip. 

See you next year!

This place definitely live up to the reputation. These pasties are so on point and are reasonably priced. There is a good selection of beer and great atmosphere. Be prepared to share a table with another group but don't worry about it being awkward. I will be back soon for more, the shepherds pie won me over.

I was so excited when I read about this place - it was something I never thought I'd find. Backstory - when I was a teenager and would hang out weekends in Harvard Square my favorite place to eat was Warburtons - anyone remember it? It all connected with the Susan Howatch novels (Penmarric) I was reading at the time - anyway I digress. Suffice it to say that the whole pasty concept was intriguing and this place was terrific. It closed down years ago but I kept hoping I'd find something similar ... someday.

To present day, newly come to the area. We finally made it to the Mesa location. I was glad there wasn't a wait, but walking in was a strange experience. It was dark, loud with no one at the entrance to seat us. Figured it wasn't that kind of place. The decor was a definite turnoff for me - cold, weird seating that felt like a black and white railroad car. I hate to be nit-picky but the first thing I saw when I sat down was a spider going up the wall next to me.

Ok, enough on atmosphere. The food ... huge menu that's a lot of fun to look at with lots of choices. I had the Greek salad and Greek chicken pasty. The salad was great - enough for 2. MH had the Mexican, which was actually quite spicy, and he's very used to spice. Overall our opinion on the pasties was ... ok. Quite filling - we only had half each. However, we thought they'd be a bit bigger to justify the cost, or a dollar or two cheaper since they don't come with anything else.  The dough was sturdy, well formed for holding the fillings but it was definitely hard.

Re: the service - it was good - she was friendly ... but it was hard to find anyone when we wanted anything, especially when we wanted to pay and leave.

I hesitated writing this since everyone seems to love it so much, but this was my experience ... not bad, but not somewhere I want to spend my precious restaurant dollars for a so-so experience. The atmosphere was kind of off-putting. Given everything, I don't think we'll be back. And I had such hopes! Sorry Cornish Pasty!

You've got to give this place a try!  The ambiance is great.  Eclectic flair, and most of the employees have piercings and tattoos.  Their pasties are soooo good.  You should know that when you order, the ingredients cannot be subbed out.  They come as they are written.  Everybody we bring here loves this place too.  Their beer selection is great, offering local brews from around Arizona.  Prices are reasonable.  Was surprised this past weekend that they had the turkey and stuffing pasty and I was thrilled to order it.  Each time I come, they are out of that one.  It was delicious!!  Wife had the eggplant parm pasty and nobody took home leftovers on this night!

I grew up down the street from this place and it's in a strip mall I visited frequently, but I never went. I assumed it was a mom and pop place with consistently good food (it outlasted many other businesses in the complex), but maybe a little boring. My sister suggested we go there for a family dinner and I was so surprised when I walked in! Finally, a reason to check that little box for "hipster" ambience on Yelp! 

Every server who walked by greeted me and told me I could just take a seat, but unfortunately there was not a big enough table for my group, so we started the list, which just grew and grew as more people tried to get in for their pasties! They have great patio tables outside and long community tables and bar seats inside in their newly expanded space. 

It was a little dark and loud once we finally sat - not good for an overly tired infant we had in tow or my dad who has a hard time hearing in loud settings. As I mentioned, all the servers were great, except for some reason, ours. She was very rushed and unfriendly unfortunately. But, despite that, I really liked the place! 

They have a whole page for vegetarian pasties, but once I actually look, I wasn't too impressed that they rely heavily on Quorn (fake meat), but there were a few choices of just veggies and I could get the balsamic mushroom pasty and be happy every time! However, my mom got the same, but with chicken and thought the balsamic taste was a little strong. They ran out of their chips, so we had their coleslaw, which was good. 

I definitely plan on going back, maybe trying their Tempe location for their happy hour!

I've eaten at a different Cornish Pasty location and had a much better experience with my food.  Otherwise, my review would have been 2 stars.  I ordered the Rosemary Chicken pasty and was pretty disappointed with the taste and quality of the item.  I would avoid it.  The chicken was low grade and the unappealing slimy texture of the items inside the pasty made it appear to be not fresh, like a glorified hot-pocket.  I did not like the choice in flavor of the cheese with the rosemary, and it was all rather bland.  My dinner party ordered the Pavlova desert, and it wasn't something I would order.  They all love that desert, but I found it very unappealing.  Lots of sugarless bland whipped cream, some fruit, and the meringue texture was just weird to me, but I have no idea if that's how the Pavlova is traditionally made.  Considering my first experience at a different location being good, I would try something else on the menu and avoid the Rosemary Chicken and Pavlova.  I personally wouldn't be quick to pick this place for dinner.  Our service was fine.

A great place to relax and catch up with friends. Awesome drink selection, including craft beers on tap. Shoot pool, listen to live music on Friday nights. The ambiance is chill with dim lighting, and it doesn't get overcrowded.

Tandoori wings and the Scotch eggs are tasty. The pasties here are amazing. I never knew I liked pasties until coming here and trying several different creations. I usually share one pasty with a friend, but if you're really hungry, get one all to yourself, but save room for the delicious beer! 

Great service, all the bartenders and servers I've come across are friendly. I love coming here for the comfortable, vintage vibe. Definitely a keeper.

A nice dog friendly place and the service was excellent. Both my husband and I had the Shepherds Pie Pastries. The crust was perfect, you bit into it and it was flaky and crunchy. It stayed together well. The sauce was creamy and complimented the pasties. It was filling and so good. I wish they had offered a mini sample platter so we could have tried more.

Great place for meat pies that are not common at most restaurants. The atmosphere is attracting the mid twenty year olds, with the music they play, so maybe if you're older eat on the patio. Lots of choices, even for vegetarians. The prices are a bit high for the amount of food you get.

Cornish Pasty used to be our go to and a place we would tell everyone about. A place to go with friends and bring co-workers, and tell family about... And I do think this place is unique with a cool atmosphere and generally speaking the food is okay. And though usually the service is slow, forgetful, and lets be honest- sub par... we had a pretty good waitress today.  However, once she left her shift-- we were not checked up on or given coffee or water refills... for only... hmmm... 7 hours. My husband and I were catching up with a friend we hadnt been able to get together with in awhile...  and having great conversation... and the place was VERY empty today, on a Saturday.The outside was desolate, and there were at least four plus empty tables inside and a mostly empty bar on our way out. Not a good sign for business on a Saturday night. We kept waiting for someone to come over and offer us more water... we wanted to get some drinks, dinner, and dessert since we were there so long-- but NO ONE came to our table in all of that time. And no, I am not chasing down a waiter at a resteraunt to get service! One guy (the owner?) came to our table and lit the candle but did not offer any drinks or food seeing our glasses and to go boxes empty... he walked by us multiple times! Then the service folks decided to start looking our way and whispering... ( instead of trying to get a higher tab, funny) and a large group came in and was glaring at us (though there were many empty tables and couches in our vicinity). So we decided to leave- I mean it is hotter than hell in there, you can not feel the air conditioning!! This is Arizona come on people! No water!! I am so over this place. We literally sat there with money to spend and no service! We were testing them after awhile, waiting to see if someone would come over. We gave them every chance. I guess we will spend our money elsewhere. And I definitley will not be referring this place to anyone anymore as the food has also been going downhill for awhile. We got the pilgrim which was luke warm and mushy... and just not very flavorful. And the meat and cheese was crumbly and tasted like mince meat instead of sausage. Enough is enough.

I love this place- we are a vegan-vegetarian family and I can't believe I haven't heard of this until this year!  We come from Michigan originally where pasties were as common as lakes and these are AWESOME.

I'm ashamed that I haven't left a review for this place yet. I've eaten here for a good while and I've never been disappointed with the food. Well, there was this one time, but it was because it was sold out. I'm okay with that, it tells me it was really popular that night. Anyway...

The prices are good, the teas are good, and it's just fun to sit in the pews while watching the candles melt. Every friend I've brought here has had a good time with an equally good meal. I'm a sucker for the royale with cheese and a side of thousand island.

You know what, look at the average review score. I really think that's the most telling part of this place. Really. Go. Eat. Enjoy.

I could eat here everyday. The variety of different pastys are awesome!  Chicken tiki masala is definitely #1. The music gets a little weird but the atmosphere and awesome and the beer selection rocks. Not only that but they do have some of their pasty's in vegetarian form - so when you aren't feelin' meat you still get an freakin' awesome tasting pasty.

The only choice is the Oggie. The other options are for Emmits.
The Oggie has all of the right ingredients, and tastes great. Unfortunately, the meat and veg in the Pasty are mixed together and not layered, and the crimp is not traditional. They are also about half the size that they should be. Maybe a Saltash thing. Also, if you offer real tea, you need serve the right way, with milk, and options of honey or cream.

With all of the constructive comments said, the Pasty was great, the atmosphere was great.

It is really surprising to me how so many reviewers can miss such an important point about this restaurant: It is absolutely not worth the money! I give this place 2 stars for it's good ambience and service. 

I ordered a Portobello Chicken Pastry and it was small. Taste was about okay and I ended up paying $12 before tip. I really think that they should have included a side or two with this.

The food at this place is so amazing!   I can't wait to go back.  I had the salmon pasty and it was a real joy to the mouth.  There were 6 in our party and all of us were very happy with our food.  My pasty was so large I could only eat half, YEAH I get to have the other half tomorrow for lunch

The Cornish Pasty Company has quickly become a favorite of mine, and their location on Alma School and Baseline is a great option for devouring one of their baked gems.

The restaurant has a large interior and exterior seating area, although it can quickly become packed. A full bar is available with lots of English and American drink options including local beers.

Pasties are essentially large and far superior Hot Pockets filled with any number of options. My fellow diners chose the Carne Adovada with a spicy filling. I opted for the Peppered Steak with tender beef combined with Stilton cheese and vegetables in a pepper gravy. The combination was extremely delicious.

We shared a dessert similar to the southern banana pudding which was just OK. Service was slow on an otherwise slow night, but the food was worth it. This is a great option for groups with a wide variety of unique options or anyone wanting something different.

I have visited Cornish Pasty too many times to count: some visits before the expansion as well as after the expansion.  Each visit is consistently delicious as my first visit.  Cornish Pasty is definitely a favorite place for me, and I even have family and friends who are vegetarians and vegans who love it just as much!  The Place actually has more than just a couple selections for vegetarian options; they also have at least four different vegan pasty options.

I don't think you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  I can't exactly pinpoint an item for you to try, since I have loved everything I've tried... I will tell you, though, that I have tasted AT LEAST one item in each section: pasties, sides, soups, and salads, minus the dessert section, and everything is ALWAYS satisfactory!  If you need an recommendation for soup, the "Mushroom, Walnut, and Spinach Soup" will leave you feeling warm and good all inside.  I always end up feeling fully satisfied from one half of my pasty along with one side that is shared between me and my boyfriend, so I never have enough room for dessert.  It has been so hard to go in there and order only dessert, especially when their pasties calls my name!  However, I do keep hearing that all of their desserts are very good--I WILL try them some day!

Along with the food, I am impressed with the staff/service - my boyfriend and I always get exceptional service. Our waiters always go out of their way to make us feel like we matter!  I also dig the ambiance/seating arrangement.  Some of their seating is interesting, as they are equipped with church pews--it's a pretty cool touch.  With its pews and European atmosphere, I feel like I'm not in AZ anymore.  Now, if you find yourself going to Cornish Pasty more frequently, try to sit at the counter near the open kitchen at least once - it's fascinating to watch the cooks diligently and precisely make the food; a lot of love goes into the food and I think it shows in its delectable taste!

Just try it already! I hope you enjoy your experience here as I always do!

This is my favorite restaurant/bar in town. The pasties are AMAZING and the beer choices are awesome, not mention decently priced (though together you should expect to spend about $40 for two people). The Chandler location is the only place I've ever found with Franziskaner Hefeweissen on tap!

Tasty options no matter who you are or what you crave! This is not just standard English fare. The geniuses have conjured up Indian, Mediterranean, Mexican and American favorites that are all delicious. If you are vegetarian you won't be disappointed. 

Vegans call ahead because the selection changes almost daily and while they try to keep some on hand (special vegan dough prep /vegan cheese / alternative recipes), I have found this location to sometimes run out of the vegan pasties. 

If they happen have the vegan spicy BBQ you should absolutely get it. This location does it best! Cornish Pasty please keep this one on the veg menu permanently!

The food was overall outstanding! We were visiting relatives in Phoenix and love to use Yelp to find local eats and this place did not disappoint! As a family traveling with 2 kids (16 and 12) we were nervous that it appeared to be a dark bar, however it was just fine. The foods were very rich and tasty. And the chicken wings were outstanding!! The food came out a bit slow, but we had a large party of 7. We will definitely add this to our list of favorites for when we visit Phoenix again.

The family and I wanted to try this eatery out. Mistake was, going on a Friday night at 5:30. Seating was good, as we're the Hostess and Server. Food for we two adults was wonderful. Both kids, 13 & 11, didn't care for their order, a Chicken Pot Pie, and The Pilgrim. We planned to box these up and made lunch the next day of them both.
Ambiance of this place was noisy, the seating uncomfortable and dark, the music was blasting too loud to where my GF asked twice to lower the volume. 
By the time we were about finished our meals, a group of "Bohemians" showed up, occupying the area next to the bar, directly behind out seats. Apparently, these unwashed college aged idiots, smelling of Cigar smoke, from the Cancer Emporium, ie, Cigar store, next door to this restaurant, and body odor, came in loudly talking, swearing, wearing their damn hats to the side, like so many SubUrban Gang Banga, wannabes, ordering shots of some quantity, generally ruining our evening out. Their unpleasant stench, literally gagged the 4 of us, and the unfortunate family that shared our Pew. Pew, what an appropriate term for that time! These morons, finally moved away, thankfully, as I was about to land a size 13 boot, upon someone's ass. I guess, if I was 20-30, and chasing hairy under armed and legged young women, this is the place to be!
I'll go back there for the lunch time, never again for dinner. 
Overall, the place is painfully in need of a make-over, in caliber of decor, and clientele.
Too bad, as the food was exceptional.

I ordered a balsamic portobello pasty with the chocolate bread pudding, and I loved the pasty. They give the option of leaving half of it uncooked so you could heat the other half later and enjoy a fresh pasty later on, although I opted to devour the entire pasty at once. 

While the pasty was delicious, I found their bread pudding's brandy sauce to be far too overwhelming. The dessert ended up tasting more like an alcohol sponge with select unsaturated spots than it did like actual bread pudding.

I feel like I've been magically transported back to Seattle's Capitol Hill neighborhood every time I step into this restaurant (which I won't explain any further, if you've been both places you know exactly what I mean). I love that they've taken something as traditional as pasties and made it so gourmet yet accessible. There is a pasty for everyone, from a Thanksgiving dinner, to Mexican, to Indian. My two favorites are the Cottage Pie and Lamb Vindaloo (two completely different but equally delicious choices). They are super filling so take your second half home and enjoy one of their delicious desserts. I recommend the strawberries pavlova or the chocolate bread and butter pudding. Also, beer, big beers.

It's believed that the pasty was invented for miners. They were a way to get a full, nourishing meal that miners could transport easily and eat without cutlery.

I'm not sure that's what Cornish Pasty Co had in mind when they opened up. Sure, the place is dark, like a mine. And a lot of the waiters have crazy beards, similar to what the old miners sported. That's where the similarities stop, though. This place is H.I.P. Was mining hip? Probably not.

They have a hundred thousand beers to choose from. And every single pasty I've tried is SO SO SO good. The dessert takes the cake (but it isn't cake). PB&J Pasty, with ice cream on the side! Ooey Gooey peanut butter, jelly and bananas.

The only reason CPC doesn't get the full five stars is the service. It's usually awesome. Every now and then, though, you'll get someone who is too cool for school. That'll ruin it! I still highly recommend this place, though. Amazing food, awesome atmosphere and mostly good service.

Simply amazing.
Everything on the menu is excellent. The imitation ground beef is even good. While eating my girlfriend's vegetarian shepherd's pie, I didn't even realize it was imitation until it was already gone.

Great service, awesome atmosphere and decor. Very reasonably priced. Great happy hour.

Also, I just can't seem to get enough of the Strongbow Cider that they have on draft. If you haven't been to Cornish Pasty yet, you need to get off of Yelp and drive there immediately.

This place is simply awesome, I haven't tried a pasty I haven't liked yet.  Service is always friendly, and it's always happening at this awesome local restaurant.  Try the Royale with Cheese, simply awesome!!!

I almost felt underdressed walking into the Mesa location of one of my very favorite eateries. Being used the to hot, crowded, loud Tempe location, hubski and I showed up in our jeans and ratty we-were-thinking-about-going-to-bed-but-decided-to-go-Cornish-style-instead shirts.

In this location, the owners had a little- ok a lot- more space to be creative. The seats are church pews. There are candles in wine bottles. I won't ruin everything for you, but just look closely at the tables.

Although the space is larger, the decor helps to maintain the cozy comfortable quality we love about Cornish-Tempe.

I ordered the Spicy Asiago Chicken- veggie style. Hubski got the veggie tikka masala. They were both delicious, as always. We went back with a friend a couple of nights later and ordered the caramel apple pasty and the banoffee pie. They were out of bananas so they substituted strawberries. It was tasty, but bananas really belong to that confection. The apple caramel pasty was PMS-licious!

We love this place and we'll be back soon... maybe tonight!

Oh- and a shoutout to Lindsay B.- no trans fats in sight!

I've been a handful of times now, and it just gets better. I vow to try a new pastry every time, and every time it is delicious! I love the vegan options as well. Everyone I bring to this little speakeasy loves it. The ambiance is what really sets it apart from other places. It's a hip, cool environment that really makes you feel like you stepped into Ireland. It is great for date night, or happy hour with friends. 
Every server we have ever had has been very nice as well.

Have visited this location several times and have never been disappointed. The place has a very cool hip vibe about it as well as having excellent food and a great selection of beer. Wife always gets the carne adovada which is so good and favorable.!i have had the pilgrim the Reuben, bangers and mash meat and cheese just to name a few and all are wonderful. Fries are killer as well as the soups. All in all a great place for lunch or dinner.?

Second visit. Just as good as the first time. This place does not disappoint. Suggest everyone put this place in their rotation.  Fair prices, and they dont skimp...on quality or portions. Just as it should be.

Nice place and pretty fast service. The pasties are pretty good - not even close to "Butte (Montana) pasties", which have a lot more meat, but not bad either. They are reasonably like the authentic Irish pasties, but growing up in western Montana, I was spoiled. Would return - not often but from time to time.
Love the desserts here the most, especially the apple caramel pasty.
Oh yea, Turkey singer in July in the form of a Pasty! To die for.. Cranberries, sweet potatoes, Turkey and gravy.
Great flavor and good portion size. Very filling.!Meatball pasty was a good choice for younger kid.

For ages, the only location for the Cornish  Pasty Co. that I went to was the location in Tempe, which I also gave 5 Stars.  I give 5 Stars to any golden standard that I can always come back to or if it's one of those places that I'll take a friend to who's never been.

Somehow, this location in Mesa is better.  The Tempe location still deserves my full 5 Star-rating, but this one surpasses it.  It deserves maybe a 5 GOLD Stars or something like that.

My friend Chris came in from out of town and had a hotel room in Mesa.  I reserved a Zipcar, picked him up and this where we ate.  Everything was perfect.  I love the outdoor seating, I love the indoor seating, I love the decor and the food doesn't fuck around.  The taste doesn't tip-toe and pussyfoot around while you chew on it, it loads the flavor into a shotgun shells and fires it into you mouth and laughs at you when you're taken back by how delicious everything is.

I love taking friends to places like this because you get to see their over-the-top reaction to it as well.  It's like when you watch one of your favorite movies with a friend who's never seen it and you get to keep saying, "Oh, this is the best part."  With the Cornish Pasty, it's the same thing, so many elements are the best part.

I want to be baked into a pasty and I want to eat my way out of one, but I don't want to drown in gravy or something.

LOVE THE FOOD and ordinarily the service is good. My last experience wasn't the greatest. Our server seemed incredibly put out to be servicing our table (a table of 12 women) and while I understand large parties can be tough, the way she approached us set the tone for the rest of the night. Brash and rude, snappy and annoyed. 4 stars because the food is amazing and I'm hoping my next visit will be better
Very delicious food. Lots of options. Beer selection was okay but you're going here for the grub mostly! I've been back several times!

The quality of food here is consistently amazing!
3rd trip here and 3rd different pasty. 
Enjoyed the Portabello-Chicken Pasty w/ a salad and finished every bite (okay, I split it with a friend, their servings are plentiful!)  Perfectly cooked and flavorful; it's served with a side of marinara that I could have eaten alone with a spoon! Everything's good here. If your a soup lover you MUST try the mushroom soup.  My salad was fresh and their house dressing is this amazing creamy basil goodness.

The staff is very friendly and do a good job at paying attention to the little details. 

The only reason they don't get 5 stars is the music is a little loud for this small of a space.  During lunch I think it could be turned down, save the loud music for happy hour.
We love Cornish Pasty. The atmosphere is awesome and every time we go it is delicious.

Had a vegan friend coming in to town, called in, and apparently they offer 2 vegan options every day. She loved it. My friend and I out of respect, ordered vegetarian dishes. With the quorn chicken, I couldn't tell the difference. Awesome food. Great service. Giant beer.

My husband and I love this place. Seriously. We go here several times a month. BUT, we went in tonight (a Thursday), and they were relatively steady...normal business for a Thurs. We sat at the bar, where we always do, and had a bartender that we have had many, many times before. I sat down while my husband went to the bathroom, and was there for several minutes before anyone greeted me (the bar wasn't full). Two more people came and sat next to me and they were immediately greeted and presented with drinks and menus.  I found this to be incredibly off-putting, regardless of how much of a regular we are. Still waiting on a greeting, my husband came back and sat down. The bartender (female, 1 of 2) approached me and very curtly asked IF I wanted a drink. ?? Yes?? It took several more minutes to get the drinks, and even longer to get menus. Once the menus were there, it was like someone pushed fast forward. At this point, both bartenders were asking us for our orders about every 2 minutes. My husband finally asked, politely, to give us some time, we were in no hurry and enjoying our drinks. This continued anyway, so finally we hastily decided on dinner. The female bartender continued to be short with us, did not smile one time, and never actually came to where we were sitting to speak to us. She was constantly doing something else, yelling across the bar. She tried several times to remove our plates while we were still eating. It seemed like the 2nd bartender (male) was a trainee. I kept telling my husband that she was making me uncomfortable because she was rushing us (she asked us 3-4 times in a span of 5 minutes if we were ready for our bill, or if we were going to have another drink). Additionally, she asked us, "2 checks?"
 This is ironic because we came to this location after our wedding for dinner just months ago. We have also been here hundreds of times and never asked for split checks (we are not hard to forget, I have bright red hair and my husband has an impressive beard). We ended up paying in cash and decided to leave without finishing. As we were leaving, my husband offered her some constructive criticism. She was extremely defensive and blamed everything on the 2nd bartender, with whom we had very little contact. She offered no apology or acknowledgement of her behavior, she just said "Okay" and walked away. We told her we would be back, but basically that we expect better service than this (honestly, this was the worst I have ever been treated by a server). I was so disappointed, uncomfortable, and put off. I worked in the restaurant industry for over ten years. I understand having bad days, being busy, in the weeds, wanting to leave before 2 AM. But it is dangerous to treat a customer as such when they spend quite a bit of time and money at your restaurant. Other customers can see that, too. I sincerely hope we don't experience this again, because we really do love CP!

Love this place. I haven't had a pasty I didn't just love. At our last visit we split 3 between the 3 of us, Cottage Pie, Chicken Pot Pie and Carne Adovada. So yummy and I'm sure the left overs will be just as delicious.
i had peppered steak , it was amazing ,I love the fry chocolate dessert as well . definitely will go back !

British food? In Mesa? Doing successfully in one of the most cursed plaza's in Mesa history? Yes, yes and yes, apparently...

I've always wanted to try a pasty...glad I was finally able to. On walking in, you realize the place is so British, that there's actually a bit of culture shock. The big long tables and benches may have you questioning whether or not you should sit down at one of these tables with an already seated party, and the answer is YES, you should! Thats how its done on the other side of the pond, and thats how its done at the Cornish Pasty Co.

They have a pretty good beer selection. My party of 3 split a large greek salad, and we could have used another one or two mouths to help us out. The dressing it comes with is a lemon pesto salad dressing, which was delicious. A word of caution, however: A little goes a long way. Its pretty thick, potent stuff. But it really does go well with the red onion, olives and feta in the salad.

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala pasty, and later I was also able to try the Chicken Pesto pasty. Both were very very good, but I liked the Tikka Masala a little better. It seemed like it was a very popular choice there as well. I would say on both pasties, the side dressings left a little to be desired. The tikka masala comes with their version of raita, a traditional indian yogurt dressing, but their flavor (while not tasting bad) did seem kinda off for some reason. The pesto chicken came with marinara, and again it seemed a little off.

The clientele here is a pretty mixed bag. The servers are the tatt'd up, facial piercings type, which Im not sure exactly why that is, but I dont mind it. Im not judging anyone, but there seemed to be a lot of lesbians in the place too. I have not a clue why either would be the case, but It didnt bother me--just struck me as odd. The place at 5:30 was PACKED. You come any later and you WILL NOT get a seat.

One last thing that I would like to mention is that for the vegetarians out there, this place is extremely veg-friendly. Practically an entire page of their menu is dedicated to pasties with quorn fake meat products, which although I didnt try, Im sure would be fantastic.

I will definitely be back soon, though maybe next time Ill try lunch and see if its maybe a little less crowded.

Great Food? Check. Quality Service? Check. Fun environnent? Check. Good beers on tap? Check. Food I crave? Double check.

That about sums up all you need to know about cornish but if you need to know more just think of the best hot pocket you ever had, multiple the quality by a million and you have a pasty. I have tried numerous items from here ranging from the homemade sausage salad (too big for a single sitting so leftovers=winning) to the lovely bit 'o salmon to the strawberry pavlova dessert and it is all great. 

My biggest problem coming to this place is the near pannick attack get from having to choose from too many great options. I'd tell you what my favorite pasty was but that would imply that one is better than the others which simply isn't true. Plus they have something for pretty much everybody, the only thing is if you are super picky pastys are cooked to order but not made to order so ingredients can't be swapped. Even then anybody I have ever come with has been able to find something.

It had been 18 months since I went here last and my friend wanted to go somewhere for lunch that was not the "same-old, same-old" burgers, subs, Asian, Italian, or deli stuff for lunch. "How about Cornish Pasties?" My friend was baffled. I explained that these are a turnover type pastry outside stuffed full of all kinds of savory meats, cheese, veggies, or dessert fillings and then crimped and baked. They are common in the UK. I also told her this would not be a quick service since they wait until you order your pasty to bake it (comes to the table fresh and piping hot).

Parking is close to the door. The staff is awesome and was attentive the entire time we were there. There are booths, tables and chairs, indoor seating and outdoor seating. The interior has the look and feel of a British pub. 

The pasties are in the $8-9.50 range. My friend had the Pilgrim (Roasted turkey/chicken, sweet potatoes, grilled onions and stuffing. Served with red wine gravy and cranberry sauce) and a soda. I had the BG Tips British Tea and the Spicy Asiago Chicken pasty (Spicy chicken, roasted corn, black beans, asiago cheese, hatch chilies, and Mexican stewed tomatoes with a side of sour cream & salsa). Totally delicious!

I really wanted to try the desserts, but the serving sizes are so large there was no way either of us could eat another bite. Someday I will have to stop by and have the BG Tips British tea and sample one of the desserts.

FOOD:
     Cheese steak pasty ($9.50):  Good amount for the price and good overall, as the pasty was flaky. However the steak was a bit chewy.  I didn't care for the red wine gravy as I'm not a fan of bitter.

     Oven chips ($3.75):  I wish the fries were crispy.  The garlic flavor was good though.

OVERALL:  If I am ever in the city again, I'd consider coming back for other pasties but not the oven chips.

AMAZING. One of our favorite places to go. They recently remodeled and made the place bigger. They have some of the best soups I have ever had, and their pasties are incredible. I have tried many of them, and have yet to be disappointed. Great atmosphere, and delicious food. We will continue to come here as long as we live in Phoenix.

It's simple math, folks...excellent service and excellent food= a major hit! The waitress made me feel at home by giving me a sample of a beer to try as well as their mushroom soup. My buddy that I had not seen in a very long time suggested this place to meet. I was more than pleasantly surprised. I loved the decor just as much as everything else! The selection of pasties was extensive. I cannot wait to take my boyfriend as well as all my friends here. Thank you for an exciting experience.

Great ambiance! I liked the dim atmosphere, candle lit tables, dart board/ pool table, dark pub feel. The food was unique and they had a decent variety of pasties. Service is was fair. We'll be back. 

Food: 7/10
Atmosphere: 10/10
Price: 7/10
Service: 5/10

This place has an absolute abundance of atmosphere and the food's pretty good too. I had both the shepherd's pie pasty and the Italian the two times I came here and I could just not get enough of the chocolate bread pudding it is out of this world good. This is the kind of place you consider just sticking around at and ordering another plate it's got such a great vibe. Would highly recommend to anyone with a group of young adults who are trying to relax, have some conversation, and don't mind having some great pocket pies to go with it.
Great representation of an English Pub.  Food and service were quite good.  I highly recommend the broccoli/cauliflower baked dish; I could've made a mean of that alone.

Cornish Pasty always makes me a happy girl. They have great beer, yummy food, and the staff is the best! The menu has a ton of choices for meat eaters as well as vegetarians and everything is made in house. The patio offers additional seating and the iPad is always playing memorable music.

I came here a couple weeks ago with my boyfriend. The food was really good, I have no complaints there - I'd highly recommend grabbing a bite. But I think next time I'd get it to go.

First, it was SO HOT in the restaurant. I didn't want to sit outside because of the heat... Maybe they didn't want to turn the air on yet? Regardless, those little fans they have don't do very much. I was literally sweating. My other complaint on the ambiance was how incredibly dark the restaurant is. Combining heat and darkness is miserable. How I stayed awake throughout the meal is beyond me.

I'll be coming back for sure but it will NOT be during the evening and probably not in the summer.

Finally knocked this one off the list.  I now understand why the average life span of a 15th Century Cornish miner was like 30 years... these Pasties pack a wallop.  Not the best meal but very hearty.

We have been wanting to try this place for quite some time. We actually had gone out earlier that evening. As we drove past the area, we both kind of thought the same thing and I turned into the parking lot. As we walked up to the establishment, the patio was about half full so that is of course a great sign. We walked in and the place was definately hopping. The bar was about two thirds full and the tables were all taken as well. Again, a good sign that people like to come here :)

So we took the two seats up at the bar closest to the entrance just in case we need to make a quick get away if we do not like it...just kidding. I like the fact that the crowd of people that come here are varied. It is nice to have a place that every different type of person can go an ejoy a drink or two with company they keep. After ordering a few drinks we looked over their menu. I thought I died and went to fat heaven. So many things sounded delicious...especially their desserts. After a quick and conjoined consensus, we decided to order the 'chips' and then split the chicken pot pie pasty.

Before we were fed, I noticed a few pretty great things about this place. They actually use wax candles instead of the crappy oil burning ones most places do now a days. On top of that, they were placed inside old Jameson and vodka bottles! (See picture) Just adding the the already dimly lit casual bar feel of this place. there are a few pictures and things hung around the high walls for a effect but the thing to really notice is the benches they use for the long tables in the front center of the restaurant. (See picture) They are old church pews! Ha! There are very few things that impress me with astonishment and this is one of them. Whoever thought of this was a very smart man/woman.

Okay, so back to the food... when it came out I could just tell by looking at is it would be good. (See pictures) The 'chips' also known as french fries around these parts :) were probably some of the best I have ever tasted in my entire life. I am almost positive they rank within the top 3 for sure. They were freshly cut, seasoned and fried to the ideal consistancy. They were soft where they should be and crispy around the edges like fried should be as well. I really appreciate when cooks take that extra step into paying attention to culinary detail.

Then moving on to the pot pie pasty (say that 5 times fast). It was absolutely delicious! You could tell all the vegetables were fresh. The filling was not too heavy (saucy) which I truly appreciate as I was already feeling guilty about the amount of food I was about to partake in. My only suggestion was it needed a hint of salt and black pepper for more flavor but I think maybe they do this on purpose for those that are sensitive to overly spiced foods. Either way, I really do like the authenticity and quality of this place. Really? Only $9 for these enormous pasties? Fantastic! We will definately be back. Next time I think I might just have to indulge in the bread pudding as that is one of my favorite guilty pleasures in life. Cheers!
I love that it's the most English type restaurant out there butI think it's pricey for the portions you get.

Scottish Eggs. Sausage salad. Pilgrim with turkey. The first 2 sounded a little odd the first time I read it, but glad we tried them - Soooo good.
I could eat this combo everyday. Their sausage is DELICIOUS!! Some of the best I've ever had.

Oh man! I have a favorite fast food restaurant in Nebraska called Runza... every time I go there, I have to eat as many as possible. Needless to say, I had my first Cornish Pasty and holy moly, it's seriously a glorified Runza! So amazingly delicious! It's kind of like a calzone only not pizza styled. I had a shepherd's pie in mine and totally worth every calorie! :D
Excellent food and beer selecting. Scottish eggs were great and Greek pastry wonderful.

This place is amazing! The Italian pasty is incredible but the Mexican premium pasty with the slow roasted pork is one of the beat things I have ever eaten! Do yourself a favor and eat here! The prices are very reasonable as well!

Unbelievably Tasty

My friends and I went to the Cornish Pastry Company for a bite to eat, and  all I can say is; the food was unbelievably tasty. Everyone cleaned their plates and wished there was  more.

Each person in our party ordered a different flavor, and each bite  was better than the next.  Lets face it, what's not to like?  Take flavorful meat, cheese, unique vegetable combinations, wrap it up in a flakey pastry, then bake it until hot inside and crispy outside.  Serve it up with a side dipping sauce, it doesn't get much better. While your waiting  for your delicious entre, take advantage of the great beer selection the Cornish Pastry Company has to offer.  Sip on a ice cold draft from a great selection while your delicious entre is baking.
  
The Cornish Pastry Company has a great atmosphere, very casual and comfortable.  Wish my phone wqs working because I would have taken pictures. I would  definitely go back to the Cornish Pastry Company again and again.

i'm so happy i found this place.

when i heard the word pasty, it didn't exactly coincide with great food in my mind.  but that forever has changed,  the pilgrim was amazing.  hands down, best thing i've eaten in a while.  turkey, stuffing & roasted veggies with a side of cranberry sauce & red wine gravy.  like thanksgiving dinner in a little bundle of joy. 

dessert was delicious as well.  apple & caramel pasty with vanilla ice cream.  the pasty was fluffy and buttery and glorious and all of the things you want when you are feeling like a fat kid.  

nice beer selection.  i chose a trusty Guinness but i wish i had been brave & perused the beer menu a bit more. next time.

can't wait to go back.

Hot Pockets!  Every time I come here, I obsess about which pasty to pick.  Much later, I remember that it doesn't matter.  There are no big, bold flavors to be had... I'm here for the concept.  The flaky, firm dough that houses the chosen filling is the star of the show.  Second billing is the pub ambience, from the large wooden tables to the metal plates.  Third is the large beer list.
