All of the above comes for a great value.  $6.50 cent glasses of wine.  $3 Guinness on Wednesdays.  And the $3 Irish Car Bomb is legitimately the best drink deal in Arizona.

Love this place. Been here many times, never disappointed.  If you are a picky eater and often get items off of a meal choice you may not be thrilled since they prepare the pastys well beforehand. However, they have a TON of different pastys so everyone should be able to find something.

Your receipt will say it all. "$3 Car bomb..F*YEAH".. I dont even like carbombs but I tend to do atleast one EVERYTIME I go there. Also Wednesdays is $3 Guinness day.. not gonna be able to beat that anywhere.
The food is so yummy, but if you are in a hurry, this may not be the place for you.
And the owner, gooood lord! I have the biggest crush, the things I would let that man do to me.

I went there today for the first time with my 74 yr old father for dinner. He had been there before. It was extremely busy, so we waited at the bar for our table. The RUDE bald bartender was such a tool. He was annoyed that I told him its my first time there and asked him what was good on the menu. His rude response was that the one time he told someone what was good on the menu, they sent it back, so he doesn't do that anymore, and then literally walked away! I wanted to throw up when I saw and heard him rushing to flirt with some girls right next to us within ear shot. So unprofessional! What a complete douchebag!! 
I got my food 50 min later and the bartender just made the experience worse! I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS LOW CLASS PLACE WHO CANT EVEN HIRE A PROFESSIONAL BARTENDER! THIS PLACE IS A JOKE AND THERE FOOD IS BLAND AND NOT WORTH THE WAIT!

Nice wooden, yet modern interior, with candles. Staff and guests come with a pleasant grungy edge. A whole page with veggie pasty, and even one vegan option. Vegan pasty? Yes! I stuck with a veggie option (rosemary 'chicken', good) to not rock the boat too much. Maybe vegan next time, it's intriguing.

So...I'm a pasty fanatic. My mother is from Liverpool England and I grew up eating homemade pasty's all the time (and still do whenever I find out she's making them...I mean let's be honest, mom's homemade pasty's will NEVER be beat in my book). I know my way around a pasty, let's put it that way.

All that said, this place is great! Diverse selection of both traditional and unique fillings, real short-crust pastry, great sides and an amazing atmosphere. Never come here and left unhappy.
Good service, fun atmosphere, cool ambience food was yummy, food was reasonable drinks were reasonable I will definitely go back

Went there for girls night food was amazing drinks were good service was awful. Spent the first 20 minutes waiting for a waitress to show up just to take our drink order, the next 15 minutes were spent waiting for drinks. Finally waitress returned to take order and told us half of what we ordered was no longer available. After the waitress took our order she returned to tell us one more thing was no longer available, seems they had run out of just about everything. She did bring us free bread to soften the blow of being out of one other thing. Although the waitress was nice enough they just didn't seem to have enough service for such a busy night. I would definitely try it again because the food was spectacular but the service really needs to be worked on.

This place is great for a small group...It's small, dark & moody.  The food is delicious!  

At first I was grossed out by the name...couldn't imagine what type of food would be served.  FYI-a pasty is like an empanada, but they put all types of different stuffings in theirs.

DH & I shared a greek salad (delicious!) and I ordered a spicy chicken pasty & DH ordered a chicken alfredo pasty.  We LOVED our food.  

Only negative is that they didn't have a full bar...so I just ordered a glass of wine. 

Would totally go back!  This place is fantastic.
Food and experience was ok. I would probably pass on the appetizers and stick to the popular basics here.

The food here is quite good and original. HOWEVER the incredibly horrible service was impossible to overlook. We came in and sat at the bar for a good, 10 minutes until I finally asked the cook behind the bar if he could take our order. He said yeah sure, wrote it down and put it somewhere. About 30 minutes later I decide to check, walk over and ask the waitress if she can check on our food. She asks the cook, he said he never got anything. The cook says well I gave the other cook the order. So we wait another 20 minutes for our forgotten food. After eating, plates sit empty, still no waitress, so I walk over to one and tell her we need our bill. This was so utterly disappointing.
Love this place! Haven't had a bad pasty. Sometimes they do run out of certain types, so if your heart is set on one you might want to call first. Also, they do gift certificates!
I'm not sure if my wife and I ordered the wrong things, but we were underwhelmed.  The atmosphere of the place was nice, but the food itself didn't really do it for me.

This place is ok at best. The first time we came we waited at the front for about 5 minutes with no hello or anything from anyone in the restaurant. Several of them did look at us a few times but that was it. Also, this place is pretty small so seating fills up quickly. Not kid friendly in any way. The pasties are good but if there is a bit more flavor I would probably want to go there more often.

Place is dark and strangely laid out, with a weird raised and railed off island area, flanked by long bench style banquet booths. Menu seemed to have a large variety, but there are no substitutions and almost every item has cheese on it. Always makes me weary, as cheese is used to hide overly salty food and bland tastes. Had been here many months ago and was underwhelmed,  but was coaxed into giving it another shot by a coworker. I had the salmon pasty, and let me say it was actually very good! Fish came out perfectly cooked, moist and tender. Portion seems to look small but fills you up very fast! I also had the coleslaw because I felt like I wanted something cool to balance. It was very tasty, and homemade, but overpriced for the portion. Overall they managed to redeem themselves. Great place to go drinking with the boys or girls and get some heavy food to offset the beer. A solid 4 stars but to those rating 5 star... I'm just not seeing it, other yelpers. What did I miss? Service was adequate but nothing special. The novelty of a pasty is not worth that extra star.

What can I say that hasn't been said about Cornish? Start with an order of oven fries, grab a delectable pasty and finish off with some banoffee. The food and drinks are always phenomenal. The same can't really be said about the service. I wouldn't recommend getting take out here. I certainly don't anymore. Only dine-in because at least then the mistakes can be fixed. Thus saving you a trip back when you realize you are missing parts of your order or if you happen to received the wrong pasty. It is about 50-50 from my experience on them getting orders right. While the service is often lacking, the food, atmosphere and good times tend to make up for it.

I've been wanting to try this place and am I glad I did! Firstly, it definitely has a pub vibe. Love all of the long door tables and pew seating. Love the fact that you can belly up to the kitchen bar and converse with the cooks. Love the Portland hipster feel. My daughter and I split a Chicken Tikka Marsala pasty and it was delicious. I didn't care for the yogurt sauce as it was strangely sweet. I'm not a fan of tahini sauce, the alternative, in general. That's ok though because the pasty can stand just nicely on its own. And lastly, love the beer selection!! I did wish there'd been some tvs to watch college football but I have to appreciate a space where people can come to have conversations and great food and not be distracted. I am looking forward to trying more!

Cornish Pasty Company, "It's a place that makes Hot Pockets" says James. Hummmmm....that is just gross I say.  I realize the Nestle Company has sold billions of these nasty things since the 70's, but I don't want to go to a restaurant and eat Hot Pockets.  After reading the incredible reviews about this place I could not resist.
 
Not much to the outside of the place and seriously I would not have given the place a chance if I was driving by.  Inside is comfortable and inviting.  We were asked to seat ourselves and the server was over to take our drink orders almost immediately.  They have a good selection of mostly beers but the real focus here is the food.  35 or so combinations of pastry filled pies which makes deciding a bit difficult.  If you go you may want to check out the menu online beforehand or be prepared to browse the menu for awhile.  Our choice was the steak & cheese and one filled with sausage.  Both were incredible.  On the side, we had a choice of red wine gravy or mustard cream.  I asked our server which one she recommended and she said she would bring both.  Wow...funny I had not thought of that, but glad she did as both sauces were delicious. With a valley full of so-so restaurants it is always refreshing to find a truly good place to eat.
This will sound easier than it will be to execute when you dive into your pasty.  Save room for dessert.  The chocolate bread pudding!  Holy @$#t!

I come here alot and their foods are extraordinary. The atmosphere is nice too. Be sure to order their lemonade, it was squeesh fresh when we went there. Really good serving size too. Iam sure you wont be able to finish one pastry alone.:)

Overpriced specialty food.  

Also very crowded.


Service is slow.

Would not recommend at any time.

Love the Cornish Pasties here and the fact that they do so much from scratch. The appetizers, salads and deserts are awesome as well. I always get the Italian pasty and the sticky toffee pudding. Love it.
this place.. It's so low key and the beer and food is . If u want a cool place to chill, definitely come here.

The best pastys I've ever had and my wife agrees. We are accustomed to traditional pasty with crust, potato, steak, and some onion but not much flavor so you have to add ketchup. We tried the Mexican and the chicken pot pie pastys. Both filling and very tasty and flavorful. If we didn't live in Chicago we would frequent this place. Only down side is it's a little pricy for lunch and no kids menu but overall great experience. Big portions... we had two pastys split and enough food for everyone.

Well, I have to say this Establishment is a little too dark; it has a bar feel.. Hard to read the very expansive menu, but found the food to be fabulously tastes and right out of oven. Pricey for lunch but worth the price for a true pasty. Coming back just not an every week place.

Good food... awful service..... i have been here a million times and never had decent service, just a variance of bad to atrocious. Concept is awesome, food delicious, wish they would just hire a worthy service staff.

Christina is a great server, very positive energy! Loved the vegan portobella pasty. Get atmosphere and music. Definitely a good place!
.
Very very good. Unique and a treat! Vegetarian selections are broad but there is definitely something for everyone. Get out of your box and go!

We HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend this awesome place!  We both had the Chicken Greek Pasty...delicious! A very unique place to eat at. Cannot wait to go back to try something else on their menu. Try to go here!

As a native Arizonan with English heritage, I had never even heard of this place. I recently moved my office down the street and tried Cornish with a co-worker for the first time last week. I was pleasantly surprised! It was a little bit of a wait for the food to cook, but, so worth it. I tried the Pilgrim and, dang! It was so delicious!

ROTD: Part Deux.

O-M-G, That's right, OMG.

(For us who aren't 13, it means: OH MY GOD)

So the fiance and I are in town visiting her parents when lunch strikes and she asks "What do you want?"

Instantly my stance hunches over and my palms start rubbing together like Mr. Burns, "You're Hungry? Eggggseeeelllleennntt" I say. 

One swipe, one touch, and a few taps later we're following the old iPhone to Cornish Pasty's Mesa location, with me, at this point, bouncing up and down in the car like a child whose forgotten to take their riddlin for the day. 

"What's a Pasty?" She says...

"Oh-ho-ho" I respond with a Santa Like cheer "Just wait"

As we arrive the strip mall decor looks familiar, except instead of thinking this is an old timers pub, one may mistake it for a dry cleaners. 

Inside sits an area that has to be at least twice as big as the Tempe location, complete with pews to sip on your suds and nosh away at your nostalgic nourishment. 

Also Like the Tempe location, if you sit at the bar you'll see chefs hand making new pasties and the pride they put into each one. 

So 17 dollars, 2 Pasties, 2 drinks and a happy fiancee later I can confidently say "SCREW YOU RECESSION!!" because she was so impressed, she even bought :) 

Eat your heart out ,er...A Pasty, Alan Greenspan.

If you're going to call yourself the Cornish pasty company, you should know how to make a Cornish pasty. 

I decided to surprise my European girlfriend and take her to this place. Never having had a Cornish pasty I thought it might be fun. We both placed our orders and the words that came out of her mouth (edited for radio) I don't know what this is but its not a Cornish pasty. 

In short, don't waste your time.
Guinnness pasty is wonderful!!!!  There are many choices but I've preferred the pure flavored ones with meat and taters.

Yes, I have to admit this place is pretty good at what they are doing!  

I had the Chicken Greek at $9.50, which is: Chicken breast, spinach, fresh mozzarella, feta, sun-dried tomatoes, kalamata olives, artichokes and roasted garlic and tzatziki on the side, yum.  I like to add Sriracha to this particular pasty and they have it on hand!

Their Pasties are cooked to perfection, piping hot and gooey in the middle with a nice and crispy outer crust.

I also really enjoy the decor of this place, it is totally funky and eclectic.  Check out the photos of the interior. 

It has been awhile since I have been to Cornish and writing this review makes me think I will have  it again today for lunch!

Cheers!

I am updating my review because Andy, the general manager, contacted me about the situation. I am happy this situation has been acknowledged and it seems that they are truly concerned about the cleanliness of their restaurant. Like I said in my previous review, the food here is good and the atmosphere is nice. Based on the concern I have received about the matter, the taste of the food and atmosphere, I am updating my review. Accidents happen, but this was has been taken care of. I look forward to having a new and improved experience the next time I go here (: thank you.
Novel meal idea, I've had a few different meals here and all have been pretty good. Great selection of beers and really cool decorating job with old church pews.

This place is rad! Some friends of ours took us here and I had no clue this type of food existed here in AZ. It was my first time having a Pasty and I got the Philly cheese steak pasty and it was awesome.  We had the peanut butter, banana and jelly pasty for dessert and it blew my mind. How this place has not opened more locations than a few I will never know. I can't wait to go back .

A great place for lunch, dinner, drinks, whatever. I recently took my partner here for her birthday dinner, and we were both pleasantly surprised. We went around 7pm on a Sunday and it was pretty busy, so we ended up sitting at a high-top outside. Our server was attentive, but not pushy, and refilled our drinks without having being asked. For starters I got the cream of potato, leek and stilton soup. Be forewarned, if you're not used to the stronger cheese you may not like this soup! personally, I loved it. It had a bite and was served with crusty bread and butter. We shared the Oggie and the Lamb Vindaloo pasties, and both were fantastic. The Lamb Vindaloo has a great kick, and actually made my nose run. Both the lamb and the beef in the pasties were tender, and the red wine gravy that came with the Oggie was great! For dessert we got the Shirley Temple Pudding. If you've never had it before, be aware that it doesn't have the consistency of pudding like you're used to. It's almost like chocolate malt-o-meal, but doesn't really taste like it. It's chocolatey, sticky, warm and amazing! the creme anglaise adds an interesting texture to it. 

If there's only a few people in your party, you may end up sharing a table/booth with strangers, that could be the only downside. Some people love that kind of atmosphere, some people aren't keen on sharing space with people they don't know. 

The price was right. Sunday is happy hour all day, but we didn't drink. But for 3 of us, 2 soup appetizers, 3 sodas, 3 pasties and a dessert it came up to just over $40. 

We'll definitely be back!
Wide variety of good pasties, but the service could use some work.

We used Cornish Pasty Co for our wedding catering this last Saturday. They were so easy to work with and so responsive to all of our questions. We received a lot of compliments from the guests at our wedding on the food being the best food they have had at a wedding. Lauren printed menus and put them on all the tables and also made suggestions for which pasties to purchase for our guests. We served the Cajun, Shepard's Pie, Oggie, and Veggie Oggie for dinner and for the cocktail hour there were tandoori wings and Scottish eggs. If I were to do it again, I'd order more Cajun pasties because those went fast. They were also accommodating to make food for the vegan guests at our wedding. Lauren made sure to also feed me and my husband first before feeding the guests and personally delivered our food.

I've been here quite a few times since my original review, and am happy to say the food has been consistently really good!

I still think it's too noisy inside and lament the lack of handicap parking, but won't let that deter me from coming and enjoying the fare.

Now that the EU has decided "Cornish" Pastys can only be made *in* Cornwall I'm wondering if this place will have to change its name. :-0

Real let down.  We love the Scottsdale location, but this place was a waste.  Our bartender was nice, the other staff seemed more involved in their own world.  Floor was dirty, beer was lukewarm.  We ordered two sides. More jalapeos than fries on the oven chips. The brocolli cauliflower bake was awful (water at bottom of bowl, and layer of rubbery cheese melted on top). Maybe get some tips on food and service from the Scottsdale location. As we got the check, the bartender was really nice and saw that we weren't happy.  Anyhow, we were going to pay because we were hungry, but she took off the broccoli.

Everything you eat there is great, beer selection is good, this one is way bigger and less bougie than the Tempe one. More of an open feel than a locals only crowd. The Banoffie is an excellent choice for dessert.

I went with Lamb and Mint...  I can't really explain or relate it to anything per say but it was gooooood.  The dipping sauce (gravy) it came with was really good.
At first glance it didn't look like it'd fill me up but I was surprised... the meat and stuff is packed pretty dense so it works.  The bread is really tasty and crusty but not too dry.

The beers were like $6 a pop and for two of us it was $30 before tip...

I'll go back... was pretty good... lots of other pasties to try on the menu

One of the best spots in Mesa!  Cool atmosphere, great music, and super nice wait staff!  Oh, those pasties!  So delicious!  My goal is to try every single one!  Only complaint...they never have the 34 oz. mugs in stock!

Very hipster-y. Definitely do not feel cool enough to be there. Cornish Pasty company was not too bad, but I had my expectations set a little too high I think. It is great that they have a whole menu of vegetarian pasties, and vegan options too.

I got the Veggie Oggie, and it wasn't the best, but I ate it all so clearly I didn't hate it! It was just a little dry, but the ketchup helps with that. Also the fatty in me would have preferred a bigger portion. I would try something different if I were to go again though. 

I also think this place is overpriced and don't like that you cant you cant alter the items on the menu, but I understand why!
Amamzing service. Amazing food. The Cubano Pasty was delicious. Our server Matt was great. Fun personality and very attentive. We will be coming back. And we will purposely sit in Matt's section.

Place is awesome with a nice selection of beer. The food is awesome with a lot of variety of pasties. Cant go wrong with any of them but cajun is my fav. The curry potatoes and all of their desserts are awesome. Id say the only negatives for this place is the noise level for older people and the seating. You might have to share a pew with someone. Other than that everything is awesome

For lunch I had the Porky - it had roasted apples inside which added sweet detail.

They have Boddingtons on tap - that's my bff's favorite beer so I ordered one and sent him a pic for jealousy purposes.  It's a good beer, a little thicker than I'd prefer but being too thick is never a bad thing.  

Service was friendly but slow.

I've had this twice - once my friend, the penguin, brought some over - and then Saturday night we actually dined there.  The pasty itself tasted much better eating there - probably because it didn't have time to get soggy.  But the side dish, the broccoli and cauliflower smothered in bread crumbs and cheese is LEGIT.  Very unique concept, and the crowd is very hipster / bohemian - which always makes for good people watching.  I'll be back fo' sho'!

Brilliant!  I had the traditional Shepard's pie and fantastic red-wine gravy which did not disappoint, and also stuffed myself with a shared Greek salad, oven chips w/garlic and jalapeno, and a rich, chocolatey, brandy-fied bread pudding that was just amazeballs!  I am surprised I still fit into my jeans right now; I highly recommend stretchy pants.

Service was pretty slow as everyone seemed to be thrown off by the 26 ladies from the Red Hat Society that filled 80% of the seats.  The server explained they all come in once a month, so you may want to skip that day if you have a time limit.   

There are so many pasties I want to try, I can't imagine NOT coming back.  Oh, and they have Boddington's on tap!

Consistent food, fun vibe, great addition to the neighborhood! I've eaten here
A few times (dinner mostly) and have never had a bad experience. Wide variety of seating/ambiance options and a knowledgeable staff.

This place is so delicious.  I get a different pasty every time I go here and I have yet to be disappointed.  They always seem to be busy and their wait staff is always running around trying to make sure everyone is taken care of.  

They also just redid their patio seating which is really nice and much easier to eat on with the big picnic tables. 

The only bummer about this place is you can't make substations on a lot of the pasties because the fillings are pre mixed.  So make sure you get one that  you like everything in!

My husband and I love this place! Amazing food, beverages and atmosphere. If you're you know you're going to be hungry soon go there  early so you can order and by the time the foods ready you'll be ready to eat. Wait is about 20-30min for them to make to your meal. But totally worth the wait

Cornish Pasty saved our Mothers Day! After having to leave a restaurant (where we had made reservations) after waiting 2 hours for our table; we headed off to Cornish Pasty in Mesa. We were seated immediately and waited on quickly and efficiently by Matt. He was so friendly to all of us. Especially my sister (who has special needs). I was so grateful for his cheerfulness; it turned our day around! The food was served quickly and was delicious as well. We have decided that this will be our first choice next Mother's Day!

First time I tried these pasty things. haha. They were ok. These are the items that people back in the last century ate. Like miners and poor people I think... There was a story about in the menu. It wasn't anything out of the ordinary but I'll go back to try other items just to make sure I'm not missing anything. If I had to think about it... pasties are giant hot pockets that cost $10. Well, this is more of a time period food so I guess there's that additional cost to make it to represent it accurately. Although I don't think they had Mexican pasties back in the day. lololol.

It was kind of dark in there but I guess that's the mood they were going for. The entire place was mostly candle lit. Servers were nice. I say... good to go try it out at least once.

What? Where has this orgasm of flavor been my whole life. I feel robbed that my ex-buddies as of five minutes ago. Never took me here.   It's a beer and wine only place but prices are awesome. I may speak to my friends again after I'm done eating and become more intoxicated.  Usually does the trick with making me more friendly. As of now I'm hating on them for not introducing me to this sooner.
Seriously the pasties. Which are like calzones are creative and delicious. Too many decisions. Oh and the British chips are fantastic too.

Me likey what I saw. :) Didn't actually ate there, but hey, ambiance is cool, they have Jameson bottles as candlelight.  Music is awesome. Server who assisted me has become an instant favorite. Cool dude that actually paid attention. Greeted us with a smile that looked sincere (which I rarely see nowadays), A plus for you my friend!.  Loc P. and I stopped by for desserts and we had the Banoffee and Strawberry Palova. Both fairly priced and had beautiful presentation, even in To Go! So, this note will be a review in progress because I am definitely coming back to try their pasties. Cos I saw some orders coming out while waiting and it looked and smelled so delicious. Another review will be up later, for some of the entrees that I will try, cos I have a feeling I'm gonna come back very very soon. :)

This restaurant's menu isn't huge, but it is packed with delicious food. I have never left unsatisfied or felt like I didn't get my money's worth. The customer service is also top-of-the-line. This place gets BUSY (be prepared!), and regardless of whether or not there is a line out of the door, the fine staff of this establishment never lose a beat. (Even the people waiting to be seated are patiently and happily waiting for their turn for one of their amazing dishes!) I am a repeat customer, and this is the first place I think of when I'm looking for some good British food. :)

This is the kind of place that every time I have people from out of town, I'll take them there and I know they will love it. The ambiance is really nice, it reminds me of Austin's unique restaurants. Food is excellent, service is consistent and their Mushroom, walnut and spinach soup is to die for. Highly recommended!

This is one of those places that need to be experienced first hand.  The atmosphere, food, drink and service are some of the best here in the Phoenix area.  I've only been to  the one here in Mesa, but hear the one in Tempe is equally amazing (just more compact).

Do yourself a favor though.  Wait to sit outside.  It can get kinda hot inside.  Otherwise, enjoy!
Met my family here for my birthday dinner. Really good food. Great beer selection & our server Brittany was awesome. It was worth the 30 minute drive.

Loved the food it was so good and they have a great selection of beer. Also love that it closes late and I can sit down and enjoy the great food and great service. All made fresh and you can see them making the Pastys.

I LOVE cornish pasty!! The ambience is really neat but the place itself is a little small. Everytime I go, I try a new pasty and every one I have tried, I have liked. Good selection of beers (import and domestic). I personally like sitting up at the bar because staff is really friendly and chatty (if you want them to be).

If you're looking for a new place to try that's casual, this place is great!

After one visit, I think I'm sold. The moment you walk in the door, you're instantly welcomed into a very warm and inviting atmosphere. From the dark interior, to the long wooden benches and sectioned off seating, to the outdoor seating and full bar and delicious, unique, hearty food, the Cornish Pasty Company is beckoning me back for a drink with friends. They've got a good selection of draft beers, and an even larger selection of pasties from traditional options, to even vegetarian pasties. The staff were friendly and we got our food and drinks promptly so no problems on that front. 

I ordered the Oggie and my girlfriend got the Cottage Pie. Both came out fresh and hot with their red wine sauce on the side. The Oggie has highlights of sliced potatoes and chunks of tender steak. The Cottage Pie, the alternative to the Shepherd's Pie, had a good serving of mashed potatoes, peas, and well seasoned ground beef. While the red wine sauce was very good, the flavor palette fit the Oggie better as the steak had a nice roasted flavor, whereas the Cottage Pie was able to stand alone by itself.

I would definitely recommend giving them a try with some friends. If you're anything like me, your food adventures have probably not lead you to home-cooked British food. As such, this was a breath of fresh air from the hoards of mediocre ethnic foods I've had to sift through to find the gems. That being said, their pasties are perfect for hearty drinking food, and they've certainly got a good enough selection to cover the latter. If I were to provide critique, I'd have liked some board games or possibly even Jenga to make the atmosphere even more conducive for a chill drinking night with friends. Hopefully, this wouldn't ruin the comfy and warm mood the Cornish Pasty Company has going for itself, as blaring TVs and obnoxious loud music certainly would. Although they only get a 4/5 for now, the loss of 1 star is merely because I'm a reserved critic. I definitely see myself coming back, and if my experience is as good as this time, they will easily earn that 5/5 no problem. 

Short Version:
Warm, comfy, good beer selection, hearty food, vegetarian options, fair prices, a must eat!

Their soup was delicious! We came with the dog and were very comfortable and warm seating outside with our pet. They brought him a bowl of water, too. The food was delicious and the staff was super friendly!

This is one of my favorite restaurants. I have never had a bad experience here or a meal I did not like. My absolute favorite pasty is the "lovely bit of salmon." I have tried some other ones, which were all very good. Meatball appetizer, pate and curry potatoes are also fantastic. Great beer selection and friendly cozy atmosphere. Also, very affordable with large portions. Its about $10 for a pasty and I always end up taking half home.

Food is amazing! My girlfriend and I recently ordered take out from them and it was very good. She had the Italian and I ordered the Spicy Pork. I really dug mine but she compared it to a overpriced hot pocket. The garlic potatoes we ordered were ok but needed something more. I'll go there again but will have to convince her to try something different.

This is one of the coolest restaurants I've ever been to, with amazing food to match. When you walk in, everything is dim and dark, but still welcoming. All of the tables have candles sitting in liquor bottles, lighting your meal. It is a great atmosphere for eating dinner or even just having a beer.

The Pasty selection is diverse and long, making you just want to come back repeatedly to try different things. I had the Chipotle Chicken Pasty, which was over-the-top excellent! Highly recommended. There are many different ethnic food types stuffed into any Pasty, so whether you're in the mood for traditional British ingredients or if you're a fan of Greek food, they have a Pasty for you.

Service was great, attentive but not annoying. The waiter had great suggestions for a main course and even dessert. The PB&J dessert pasty is large enough to share, and can come with ice cream. It's something that sounds weird at first, but tastes like it goes perfectly together. You have to try this place!

This is one of our favorite places. Good craft beer, casual younger tolerant atmosphere, and great food. I recommend the Lovely Bit O Salmon or the Chicken Tikka Marsala that I had tonight, you can go wrong whatever tickles your fancy. Other favorites of ours are the Oven Chips and Banofee Pie! Enjoy!
Always have good results here.  Place is usually busy but they do a great job of attending to you.  Unigue food items but very delicious.  We get here every chance we get.

This place is amazing. Great food and even better atmosphere. Not the quickest service by any means, but always nice and pleasant. Seriously, the food is great. I'm not big on veggies, but out of the 4 or 5 pasties I've had (most with veggies), it's still beyond delicious. I wish they made pasties to order, but I understand the quantity they make. This particular location is one of my wife and my favorite places to go.

Great if you like college hipster chicks hosting and serving who have terrible attitudes.

Great if you like over-paying for a small meat pie with no side...they're good but not that good...

Great if you like to order simple drinks that bartenders seem to not know how to make.

I'm giving two stars because the cranky waitress who got mad when my other guest finally showed up and realized we still weren't being serviced at our table outside.... I literally walked by the host and walked all around inside, not realizing where the host stand was, so I got a table and sat myself for about 15 mins.

I've been a server so I get rotating stations and stuff, and I get that self seaters are a pain, but when it happens, just deal with it... punishing your tippers isn't the way to go about it....

Her only saving grace is she finally noticed my other guest hadn't touched her cocktail because it wasn't to her liking and she was nice enough to take it over (after they ordered 2 sod
Good, very good. Gravy is yum. Seats are a tad uncomfortable and I felt bad because there was only 2 servers but for the most part, pretty delicious.
New favorite craving! We ordered the Bangers and Mash and the Shepards Pie. Bangers and Mash was the best imo!! Fast service,  friendly knowledgeable servers. Super cool place.

Nothing far from fabulous. Good service. Variety of options (a lot of vegetarian and vegan options too), and plenty of different meat options- lamb, beef, chicken, fish. There were various Indian twists like the masala curry. Pastry was fresh and you can tell they just made it because the bakery and kitchen were in view, freshly baked out of the oven. I had the Guinness Stew and a Blood Orange Gose from AZ Wilderness and was completely satisfied with my food and drink! Even some leftover for light snack later. I'll have to come back and try more of their other dishes! Such a change from the typical tacos of Arizona

Same goodies as the Tempe location but much bigger space. This location is rather nice with lots of seating and an ambient feel. I really enjoyed my pasty but I know my parents weren't as impressed. I had the veggie rosemary chicken, yes Quorn veggie chicken is the best thing ever. The pasty had veggie chicken, roasted red peppers, roasted red potatoes and some brie; it was fantastic. We also had some pea soup, baked broccoli & cauliflower, and some oven chips. The broccoli was delicious (I have an aversion to cauliflower) and the chips were good too; remember chips=fries, crisps=potato chips. Both my parents were disappointed with their dips, the chicken pot pie came with some red wine gravy instead of chicken gravy and the chicken alfredo came with ice cold marinara, they were out of alfredo sauce. Bottled beer was a little pricey. I still love me some Cornish Pasty.

Hubby and me drove from Phoenix to try something new. The food was  incredible, it was well worth the drive and the fact that you can order half baked pasties to take home, only made me a bigger fan. Our waiter was very attentive.  This is our new favorite for sure.

I've been here once a month since my return. The first time was in June...I met up with a fellow gamer (geek alert...yes, I do play an MMORPG and no, it's not WoW) who lives around the corner from me. I didn't eat a pasty, bad me! Instead, I had their chicken caesar salad. Good lord I'd died and gone to heaven with a dish like that...not too much dressing, tons of leafy lettuce and chicken that was cooked just right!

We loved the idea of the pews. I liked it because it reminded me of being back in Scotland. :D

Service rocked it! Friendly and kick ass, prompt! They are making me fall in love with them.

A month later, I take hubby there...I order the same thing...and am massively disappointed. The lettuce is wilted, chicken is the best part of the salad and sadly, there is so much dressing I was distraught.

Again, service rocked it...but hubby was most impressed with the happy hour prices of the beers and the size...and the selection. He wasn't happy with is pasty which was ok by my standards.

Today I had a craving for a pasty. Hopped over there and had their chicken tikka. It was aight. Nothing to make me do cartwheels or dance on the tables. Ok, if I danced on the tables, I'd really be embarrassed because my ass would break it. I'm sure of it.

Anyway, I'll give this place another whirl next month and see how it goes. Maybe it might be good.

So far they're consistently inconsistent in the food, but their service is top notch.

How have I not reviewed this place yet?!  

The Cornish Pasty Co. is incredible.  

I am from So Cal and it has become my tradition that I visit it twice every time I am in Phoenix - when I first arrive and then again when I am on my way to the airport.

The pastys are so good the boyfriend and I have devised a way for me to transport the partially cooked pasties by plane to Southern California so I will have extra stock when I get home :-)

The is hands down my favorite place I have ever eaten at.  EVER.  That says a lot.

Yummmm! Great beer selection  and pasties are delicious. Staff seems a little absent minded but more or less friendly. Community seating is fun and inviting. Italian pasty kinda just taste like pizza but Cajun pasty, bangers and mash, jalapeo curry, Cornish meatballs all highly recommended. They also carry Bourbon County Stout (a beer not found in stores except during Black Friday)

Dean and Heidi are fantastic restauranteurs. Dean has well honed palate for flavor combinations and is never satisfied with the status-quo. 

He has elevated the humble pasty (comfort food for coal miners) into collection of international meals enclosed in pastry. I have eaten 90% of the pasty menu and every single pasty was well crafted and bursting with flavor. My favorites are: Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Tikka, Lovely Bit 'O Salmon, and Bangers+Mash. Always ask for double sauce!

There is a fine line-up of beer on tap, including hard to find ones like Dogfishhead 90 Min IPA. I usually do Guinness or a Black+Tan, all poured properly.

It's fun to watch staff make the pasties. They are a tattooed, funky bunch -- you will never find a more gracious group or more dedicated to getting the product right, though.

I enjoy the Mesa location with family, but prefer the grittier "coal mine-like" atmosphere of the original Tempe location if I'm alone or with the guys.

Yelp helped us again!! This restaurant was great. great beer great staff.Great Quiet outdoor seating hard to locate its technically on the cross street  A pasty  is basically individual pies filled with meats and vegetables that are cooked together. I cant waint for the Las Vegaslocation to open!!! Definately great value staff everything I highly recommend!!Great wholesome meal!!

OMG!  Finding this place was a fluke. Wasn't looking for this particular food, but wanted lunch in the area. We enjoyed fabulous Scotch eggs and some Guinness and then swapped half Roast Dinner pasty filled with house made roast beef, carrot, Brussels sprouts, and potato with M's meat and cheese that was filled with 2 types of sausages. I have to go back and try the chicken pot pie pasty and some of those desserts!! 
Service was fantastic and the food was hot and delicious!  I left with a food baby!

Always best bottled beer selections and draft selections! The pasty's well their another animal. I've tried a few different pasty's but their always delicious!!! Also try the chips with garlic and jalapeo! (their basically baked French fries!)Every location is consistent with service and quality of food!
This place was so unique and delicious.  Really really enjoyed the pilgrim.  It was like thanksgiving in a pastry.  Service was wonderful and plenty of beers to choose from.  Lovely.

Food is great service is great. Sat at the bar and watched the kitchen staff. But if you go and you buy a pie aka pasty with any beef inside order the horseradish cream sauce to go with it!!!! Cottage pie is a 5 without it and a 9 with it!!  
Please comment and follow me for more reviews!

When my son and his boyfriend caught wind that I went to Cornish Pasty without them, they insisted we go stat! So off we went!

I wasn't really hungry, but at this point I was in the mood for dessert and had already been tipped off that Cornish Pasty had some great tasting desserts.

Somehow I was persuaded into getting some garlic roasted fries, and I have to say, those fries were delsih! Glad the boys were there to share though, they made a perfect side to any pasty!

I was thrilled to see they had Banoffee Pie, so I knew I had to order it! It had a crisp graham cracker crust, nice creamy caramel, whipped cream topped with fresh banana slices, this right here is comfort dessert! Keep it simple and sweet! LOVED IT, want more!
I gave it four stars because the apple dessert Pasty was not very good. However, I did enjoy the rest of the food.

Aside from being one of the Valley's most scientifically significant People Zoos, especially relating to the study of hipsters and their culture and customs,  this establishment also produces damn good food.

Countless pasties later and I'm back for an update.

The patio had some issues so the owners (who are awesome) tore out the glass top long tables outside and added huge (seats 6+) booths with flower pots on top with cushion seats and backs.

They've added more "dessert" pasties, plus more side dishes and salads.

Sunday's now feature breakfast pasties, a bloody mary bar and mimosas.

They are doing a lot more with this location than with the original Tempe shop, which I assume is because of the added space. Whatever the reason, they are doing it right.

If you want to get the expanded Cornish Pasty Co experience, take a few extra minutes and hit the Mesa location. It WILL be worth your time.

Good food and a great beer selection.  Tried this place while in town and I thought it was a nice departure from the other options in town.  I had the Guinness stew pasty and it was delicious.  The filling was very flavorful and the pastry was properly cooked.  Also tried the meatballs with the mustard dipping sauce, which was also very good.  There is also a large beer menu, which was well appointed. Great place to try.

Okay I went here on recommendation from some Yelpers and I have to admit a personal flaw...I add letters into words and flip things around when I'm reading sometimes, so this whole time I'm thinking Cornish Pasty is a Pastry (notice the 'r') joint...

I know, I know, "didn't I read the reviews??" Yes, of course I read the reviews; but I'm like the ship Titanic...once I get an idea in my head it's really hard to 'turn the ship around' as it were...

Once I got over the initial shock that this was, in fact not a pastry place, but a pasty place; I was pleasantly surprised! This place is great! Our server was friendly, talkative and attentive. The music was a little loud, but for the setting, I think it was at an appropriate level.

I got the Philly Steak pasty and savored the flavors of the meat and man, that pasty crust was dang good too!! Yummy! Even though I had some personal problems in the beginning, it turned out to be a FABULOUS experience and I would recommend it to other Yelpers looking for some good eats.

The food was very tasty and had wonderful portions, though I did find myself wishing they balanced out the savory flavors of my Roast Dinner Pasty with a bit more sweet, either with more carrot in it or adding tomatoes, its was not the food that kept me from giving a full 5 or ever 4 stars.

What is preventing the 5 stars is the lighting and the wait staff. The lighting was so poor that my mother was unable to see where she was walking, caught the edge of platform for some couch seating and went tumbling forward, smacking face first into the hostess stand behind us. The hostess/ waitress was walking towards us and came up to our table with menus right after we righted my mother up but our neighbors and us where still asking if she was ok just dropped menus on the table and walked away without a word. So either the lighting is so bad the staff can't see if a patron trips and falls and hurts themselves 10-15 feet away, or they just don't care.

I'd still eat there again just next time i'm going to be that person wiping out the flashlight to walk to the table without and regard to the other patrons, for my safety and my families safety.

Tried this place for the 1st time my brother and best friend have been ranting about!
All in all the atmosphere was soothing low lighting, hip music, and good beers! Now for the Pasty I personally had to try the ever so popular Bangers and Mash and yeah
that pasty is a solid sell! I tried a vegetarian Pasty my sister in law had and that too
was quite delicious. Various craft beers to enjoy with your meal and wines as well. 
Recommend this place for any occasion. Overall the service was helpful and informative. Food was hot and tasty. Beer was cold and yummy. I'll be back!

I like the Tempe location better but this one is good too!  The church pews do kick ass.

Favorite pasties:  Vegetarian balsamic mushroom with mozzerella, spinach, and a side of marinara.  Peppered steak, the blue cheese in it makes it!  And for dessert the pb&j with banana!

GREAT BEERS!

Went there today with my coworkers.  We've been to the Tempe location before but thought we might get in and out a little faster at this location.  Our server Tony had a trainee with him and both of them were very charming.  When our food was coming out, Tony explained that there had been some confusion in the back and that my friend's Rosemary Chicken would be delayed but in the meantime would we all love to munch on a portabello mushroom with red sauce, cheese, etc, and they were insanely apologetic and said in addition to the substitute pasty, her original would be free of charge.  The manager came over to apologize as well and they were so nice we almost felt bad them THEM.  The food was fantastic just as it has been every other time I've eaten here or at their other location.  This time the charming "Tony"  turned the mistake into a great positive as we got to try a new pasty and got to see some awesome customer service (and training of customer service).  The way they handled it was top notch..we wouldn't have even expected TWO freebies, much less ONE since we really didn't have to wait that long to receive the correct order.  Really can't recommend this place enough, and haven't had a pasty I didn't like.

Imagine this... a delicious, flaky pie crust that's been stuffed with delicious stew like middles.  Yum... making you hungry?  It should be!  This is the kinda cuisine that the Cornish Pasty Company serves up.  And they do it well.  Really well.  So well in fact that I've told my friends in California about this place and we try, in vain, to find something similar in the Bay area.  ((sigh))  Please CPC, come to Sunnyvale, California!

Aside from the tasty food and reasonable prices, this is a joint with unique music and appeal.  It's a cool place for a date though maybe a lil loud for a meeting of any kind.  They have an outdoor patio and inside seating... and a well stocked bar!

I'd definitely recommend Cornish Pasty House to friends and in fact, will have to visit again really, really soon.

See ya there!
Really good food.  Cool atmosphere too.  Eat an early lunch cause if you don't, there will be no dinner after this place.  You can also ask for half backed to take home and heat up...

*Edit* You can see my previous post below, but I have decided to edit it.  As a fellow business owner, I feel that a prompt and appropriate response should be rewarded.  The manager's response seems completely reasonable to me and therefore I will not only change my rating but I will also be back.  I believe that the issue is being addressed and otherwise this place is great.  Thanks for responding, and hopefully this edit is a help in doing my part... although I know you guys will do just fine with or without my business as your food is delicious, I still appreciate it.  Thanks *end of edit*

So I would normally give this place 5 stars because I love the food here and the ambiance is very cool... HOWEVER, 2 of the last 3 times I have gone I have seen cockroaches there...

The first time I was sitting at the bar and there was a cockroach on their walk in fridge.  Then a couple months later I was sitting at a table in the stage area they have right when you walk in, and roach came scurrying across the railing next to our table.

I'm sorry, but no matter how good the food is, that's disgusting.  I wrote it off as an anomaly the first time, but twice?  Sorry but I have to let people know...

This is a really wonderful place! I loved the clever table set up, it felt authentic and fun. The wait staff was very knowledgable, and gave us some great recommendations. The only drawback was the wait time. I guess good food takes a while to bake.

I had the meat and cheese pasty, and it was amazing. Gooey, cheesey, and lots of yummy porky meat. That red wine gravy was tops. 

Will definitely go again, and will bring friends back.

IRISH CAR BOMBS= $3?! WHATTTT!!

Cornish pasty= Meh.
I tried half of my friends(spicy Asiago) okay, Rosemary Chicken- Worse.  The rosemary tasted strange to me just lacking some other flavors. Maybe some other spices??  I LOVE rosemary and I did NOT enjoy this nearly as much as I expected.
Next time i will stick to the desserts those looked appetizing!! Oh how I wish I would have went with my first gut feeling.  So mad at myself for that!!

Oh yelp you disappointed me so... I was expecting sooooo much from this place and I was severely let down by my choice.

I will give you another shot when someone pulls my leg again.

Someday...

This place is awesome. Great setting with $3 Irish car bombs and money pasties. The service is great with not much wait time, if any. Great beers on tap. They recently expanded the size of this location and they now have a pool table.

Also, check out the awesome and also creepy picture when you walk in to the right and tell me those don't look like zombie like humans.
Have to say, I love coming here but the hostess kind of threw our mood off with her lack of hospitality. We will be back but can't say that it will be very soon.

AMAZING!!!  Love this restaurant.  We sat on the side patio instead of inside.  The waiters were very attentive.  Promptly took our order, and the food came out quickly.  The food arrived Delicious, and HOT.  Just a warning... let it cool a little bit.  :)   I definitely recommend everyone try this restaurant.

This place always seems busy, and the boyfriend has had it a few times, so we gave it a whirl. Its quite dark in here, and it seemed quite warm to me, so I was a little distracted. The food was good. You have to want that pasty though, because that's almost your only choice! The filling choices are plentiful and I'm sure anyone can find a combo that sounds appealing. They have great drink specials too if you're looking for a deal on drinks! I'd go again!

Good food. Filling, comforting, warm. I love going in the wintertime or getting some take out when it rains. The pasties are warm and delicious. Everyone loves the bangers and mash, but forgets about the delicious soups and the awesome pasta salad. Even the vegan pasties are killer.

So my buddy and I have been here twice so far. We've tried the Pilgrim, Rosemary Chicken, Full English Breakfast, and the Chicken Tikka. We both loved the Pilgram best. It's delicious. My friend liked the Chicken Tikka, but it was a little too out there for me. The Rosemary Chicken is good, but not great. And the English Breakfast doesn't work that well in a pasty. The family style/community tables aren't my fave, but tonight we got our own small table and that was better. They do tend to run out of popular pasties, so it's best to get there before 6.   Don't love the punk music, but at least the volume is low enough that it's not too bad. The servers are super nice and helpful. The ambiance is pretty good, dim with candle lighting, which is nice. So a great place to have dinner. The pasties run about $10-$11, which seems fair. Oh, and my friend enjoys their giant Guinness as well. And that about covers it.

Update: On our third visit, we tried the bangers and mash. Hands down our new favorite!

First time I came here I had no idea what to expect. I didn't know what a pasty was. I was pleasantly surprised. Pretty genius idea to put savory foods in a puff pastry. I had the salmon pasty. OMG! It was the best one I have tried. My other friends got the cheese steak and the pesto chicken. They were definitely not as good as the salmon. The salmon had this nice texture of being cooked perfectly well. Not too over cooked and not undercooked. The sauce that bathed this salmon was creamy, but unexpectedly, not too heavy. The only downside is, it is pretty dark there so I had a hard time seeing the menu and my food, but I guess that's part of the atmosphere. I definitely will go back here and definitely recommend this place if you have never eaten here.

One of my favorite local places to eat!  I try to take a new person there every time I go so I can spread the Cornish Pasty love.  I haven't tried a pasty that I don't like with the exception of the tikka masala.  I love tikka masala otherwise, but in a pasty it just didn't taste right.  I also don't like that since all pasty's are premade you can't substitute or take out any ingredients you might not like.   That being said, this place is amazing and you have to check it out.

I was a little leary after reading about the customer service. Wow, yes it's busy and the staff is squeezing through small passages since the tables and chairs take up a lot of room, but I have no complaints. The food was AMAZING, the drinks were strong, and the service was fine (aka busy!) HINT: Go early or you will be waiting for a table. I would love to see them move into a bigger place, like maybe next to Postino's in downtown Gilbert! Hint, hint!

The worst drinks and food I've ever had in my life I would only tell my worst enemies to come to this location I couldn't take more then two bites of the disgusting food and the Moscow mule that I drank tasted like they went into the bathroom and scooped some piss water out of the urinal

This was like a party in my mouth.  My mom used to make a traditional meat and potato pasty that we ate with ketchup but I had no clue these could be so versatile. The roasted garlic oven fries "chips" were amazing perfectly cooked. I had the meat and cheese and my friend had the cajun chicken so we split it and each got half of each kind. ..server made us and I was soooo glad he did! ! I loved them both equally. . The red wine gravy is AWESOME and the home made thousand island is the perfect tang. I was less impressed with the banoofee dessert thing we tried but we will be back for pasty again

If you have not discovered this little jewel in the desert, you must stop everything and go grab a pasty and a cold beer.

I have been a frequent visitor of this establishment since its very humble beginnings in Tempe where they were so tiny and you had to wait for a chance open spot at the bar. They have since expanded the original location in Tempe and opened two more locations in Mesa and Scottsdale. 

I tend to frequent the Mesa location due to its location and convenience for me. There is a bigger hipster college crowd in Tempe, and a great place to be as well.

My mainstay is a cup of tomato soup, which is unlike any around. I have been disappointed with many restaurants tomato soup, but this one never disappoints. It comes with a couple slices of bread and real butter. 

I then order any number of pasty's, and I must say I have never met a one I didn't like. The Rosemary Chicken is always a great bet, they also offer many pasty's as vegetarian options, and have a vegan pasty of the day, just ask.

The beer selection is the bomb, and you can't beat $3.00 Irish Car Bombs all day everyday.

A great place to bring your out of townies and family, as well as make it a weekly stop for yourself.

I love the look on my moms face when we go to eat Patsys. We are Welch and she gets so excited to experience a piece of our family history. The Patsys are always amazing and the staff is great. We recently took my 95 year old Grandma here for dinner and she loved it. The audience is so fun too!
What a great place!   Food made to order and so many pasties to choose from.   I had the Shepard pie and would order again.   Looking forward to coming back!

Wowww, just wowww....so good! Never knew mushrooms could melt! I ordered the portobello chicken. I could literally taste each if the flavors, chicken, basil,bell peppers roasted, mushroom marinated and mozzarella The  distinct  flavours meld into something extremely delicate at the same time very refined, like some sort of a concoction of deliciousness. And it is extremely filling too. It was like having multiple orgasms inside my mouth, the best pasty ever! Granted I was hungry after tennis, and I am not some rich connoisseur of taste, but I can see good food when it meets my mouth, and this place is just pure gorgeousness. A must visit and your mouth will thank you for it!!

Cool place and vibe the food and beer selection was great they were stuffed with pretty much anything you could think of. Great for a group or two people. Had the steak and potatoes pasty very good and shared the Greek salad huge and tasty drinks are strong and beers are large.

1. Oven chips with garlic and jalepenos.
2. Any of the soups
3. Any of the Pasties
4. BANOFEE PIE!!

BOOM. done.

PS. My favorite soup is the Mushroom, Walnut, Spinach; my favorite pasty is the Royale with Cheese with thousand island dressing. Yes it's pretty much a bacon cheeseburger with fries but the pasty crust just makes it oh so much better. I also give the $3 car bombs a thumbs up.

First time here, our whole group loved it. Friendly service. Each of us ordered a different pasty. Delish garlic chips (fries) as an app. Lots of beers on tap...they know how to double pour a Guinness. Worth a try for sure, we will return.

It's weird, I always have the most difficult time choosing a pasty because they always sound so amazing.  Well this time,  it was different, it was like I opened the menu with my eyes closed and dropped my finger to the item at random...The Royale with Cheese!

From top to bottom I loved it all.  The medium cooked hamburger, grilled onions, mushrooms, bacon, a cheddar swiss blend and French fries all wrapped up in a golden pastry with 1000 island for dipping.  I even requested a second side of 1000 island because it was a match made in heaven.  I don't throw that phrase around that easily so when I say it.....believe me, I mean it.  

The atmosphere always puts me in a mood...you know that mood you get into when you don't care about anything...especially time.  And that's a good thing because you are in for typically a 20 minute wait while your pasty.  That's why I always order  their large Hoegaarden...it definitely adds to that mood.  

I can't decide which locations I like...but so far...if I am in an outdoors mood I go to the Tempe location and if I am in the mood for indoors I go to Mesa.  Both have great music playing in the background...sometimes Zeppelin, or Iron Maiden, or Judas Priest...that sort of music.  Their seating consists of either large picnic type tables, great for large groups or belly up to the bar to eat and drink and be entertained.  If you like to people watch..I recommend eating at the bar where you can watch the magic. 

Overall the experience is nothing short of fantastic every single time so please...never change.  But who am I to tell you what to do and what not to do.  I look forward to my next trip and the new Spicy Barbecue Chicken Pasty.  It sounds amazing.

If you read my review for the other location in Tempe, you know how I feel about this place. 

I have a love-love relationship with Cornish; there will never be any hate. Never once have I been disappointed in the food and I can honestly say I've tasted 3/4 of the pasties on the menu. 

Do I have an addiction? I think it's safe (and probably best) to say "yes". 

Their new appetizers that were just released this summer all sound quite delicious, however, I have only tried the Jalepeno Cheese Dip with Pastry Curls and I was impressed. 

Usually have awesome service here. Of course, considering the fact that my boyfriend, my roommates, and I were here at least once every couple of weeks, we were bound to have one bad experience as far as service goes. 

I will not hold that against you, my beloved Cornish Pasty Co. All of the wonderful experiences make up for that one not so great one.

For a first experience I would say this was a total bummer. Waiting for the food to be served was quite a painful process. Kids we're getting impatient , I was getting impatient and my wife was growing disappointed. This is the place out of all the options in the East valley that she picked to have dinner on Mother's Day. Wait time was horrible. 
The food was good, hot and freshly made. 
Waiting for the check was easy, that was served very quickly!!! Waiting again for our server to grab my card and pay the bill became another disappointment. My wife finally grabbed the bill and card and went up to another server and request they run our card. We paid and left. 
I was never t expecting to be compensated and was not by our server. The server that process ed our payment gave us a discount. 
Not a great first impression. I'm not sure we will be back anytime soon.

Food is very good.  Be sure to ask for Jessica M for
 your server... We've nicknamed her 'happy' because she has a terrific positive and happy attitude... And does a great job too!

I love this place. This place is awesome for food, friends, and drinks. Their pasty is wonderful. I wish I knew about this place a lot sooner so I could have eaten their more often. I always order their cheese burger pasty and its just amazing. Everything about it is delicious. I can't find one wrong thing about this place at all. Their drinks are awesome and at a good price as well. The environment is pretty darn cool. It's definitely an Irish pub so if its super packed (Friday-Saturday night) be prepared to be sitting by someone, but that's how we made some wonderful friends as well that night. Definitely will be going there again and again until I probably die.

I've been dying to come here for years finally went and so bummed I never came earlier I LOVE it so many items to love. The pilgrim is like thanksgiving came early the red pepper black bean, chicken and jalapeo soup was so good I got some to go for the next day. The British chips (fries) were so good especially in the red wine gravy that comes with the pasty! Highly recommend

Legit and authentic. 

I think I've tried them all (the pasties) and there were only 2 I didn't care for. My go to traditional pasty is the bangers and mash and when I feel like a little spice in my life I go with the Carne Adovada. If you really want to mix it up, try the chicken greek or the salmon.

Their soups are amazing. It took me awhile before I ever ordered soup at this place and now I never don't get at least a cup, even when its 110 degrees outside. The red pepper/chicken is where I started but now I can't get away from the cream of leak. I wasn't even sure what leaks were before I tried it and now I can't get enough. It has a certain addictive quality.

I also like the added apps and sides. 

Love the bar. Service is good but has a strong hipster presence. 

If you can handle tattoos and piercings along with great food and a nice beer selection this is must to check out.
Not exactly like the pasties I had over in Cornwall, but pretty damn close. Favorite is the savory pork with apple and red wine reduction sauce. Fan-freakin-tastic!

YUM! YUM! YUM!! Cornish Pasty is an awesome place!!! Most of the seating is large community tables and there is a very warm, welcoming vibe to the whole place!! They have a great selection of beers and the food was AMAZING!!! Very authentic and so delicious!! 

This will definitely become a MUST GO place for me anytime I visit AZ!!!

I have given this place my fair share of try's. I have to say it has greatly improved to a great place to dine! At first, it wasn't all that great. After the expansion and added menu items or whatever it was they changed (i.e. portion sizes), they are phenomenal. I have tried about 4 different pasties and they have all exceeded my expectations!

The service is great for a leisure hipster type place. You can be comfortable here if you're a Harley type, trendy type, business type or any blend of any type. Despite it's purposefully rustic dcor, it's quite welcoming and warm. Servers are friendly and welcoming as well.

Great atmosphere, food is great.  One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix, all their locations are awesome.  Tons of beer options, amazing specials on car bombs.  Food is stellar...my favorite pasties are the Pilgrim, Guinness Stew, Rosemary Chicken, and Cajun Chicken...but I've never had a bad one.  Seriously amazing....so so good.

This place is AMAZING!!!!!  My mouth salivates every time I think of their food.  

A great place for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike.  They have a wonderful variety of beer and wine to choose from.  AWESOME atmosphere!

TWO THUMBS UP!!!!

I still love this place.  Got addicted by going to the one by ASU.  The expanded dining area at this one is really nice.  As always $3 car bombs, ginormous beers with a good selection, and pasties is a winning combination.  Recently had the Reuben.  It was super good.  And then there is my old Lamb Vindaloo and Bangers & Mashed favorites.  I actually like too many to usually even stray from the few that I've had an loved.

i had wanted to try cornish pasty for months and finally went there. i REALLY wanted to like and i did but truly wasn't all that impressed. i had the"oggie"- it was good but nothing spectacular. my boyfriend got the veggie greek- one of the dipping sides seemed to be pure tahini, which was SO not tasty. the place was packed fora wednesday night at 8:30 and seemed to be more of a wanna be irish pub/dive bar. i could have gotten a free car bomb with a foursquare check in, but even that didn't make me give it an extra star. i'll go to the original and check it out, but not anytime soon

The people here are very polite and welcoming. The chicken tikki masala pasty is really fantastic! The rosemary chicken and the chicken pot pie pasties are divine and that red wine gravy is to die for. I also just only paid 3 bucks for pint of Guinness!

I'm sure there are those who would not enjoy the food, service, or atmosphere at the Cornish Pasty Company. They would be wrong. Don't hang around those kind of people. Life is too short. We started with the chicken liver pate and Scotch egg. Both quite excellent. I really liked the honey mustard that came with the egg but my wife requested something else and tried the tsiki sauce. Killer. Btw, these folks aren't pouring stuff out of a bottle or bucket or microwaving your dinner. This is real food prepared by real chefs who know what their doing and it shows. I hadn't had a pate in a long time so it kind of got to be 'new' again for me. First bite. Interesting. And every mouthful became more interesting and delightful. I refrained from liking the bowl because of some sense of shame if seen.We split an 'Oggie' for our pasty experience. This is I think their most popular pasty and it was very good dipped in the house-made red wine gravy. Steak, rutabaga, potatoes, and onion. There's probably fifteen or so other pasties to choose from. Note there is a difference between a pasty (short a) and pasty (long a). In some places, pasties (long a) are required. We ordered dessert based on hearing a 'wow' from a nearby table and looking just in time to see a spoon moving from mouth back to dessert. Choc cake, topping and ice cream. Yes.

Top staff. Jenny, our waitress, if she's in, ask for her. Blouse and jewelry to match her tats. And any young woman with a 'Dad' tat hits this Grandpa's sweet spot. Randy, the manager, cruises the place and seems to genunely care about your dining experience. The staff seems to like working t

One last word that maybe best describes this place. I ordered a Speckled Hen Ale. Unusual to even see on the menu. English ale. I had to try it. #1 - it was an ale of a quality I would love to drink it on a regular basis. #2 - it was served at the proper temperature so that one could fully enjoy its quality. Not that American fetish ice-cold thing that allows a nation to drink swill and not know it. Yep. Beer snob here. Sue me. But not too bad. I drink Grain Belt whenever I have a chance.

Love the location on Guadalupe, the other one on University wasn't as great as far as the atmosphere. The food is amazing. Everyone, even if you HATE peas, have to try the "mushy peas"! They are beyond wonderful. Love the look and feel of this location. The people are friendly. This is a darkly lit environment, gives you a feel for an old pub in England or Ireland.
Try the broccoli and cauliflower bake. .. to die for!

The service was nice and the food was quality. I might have just ordered the wrong thing since everyone I know hypes this place up a lot more than I think it deserves. I got the Italian and it wasn't anything exceptional. The pastry itself was amazing and their ranch is unique and really good.

I have eaten at both locations and enjoyed them.
The tempe location is crazy small and 1/2 the experience is watching everyone move in a small spot.
The mesa location is much larger and we sat at the bar and watched a well orchestrated staff put out fresh wholesome ingredients.

Be sure to try the oven baked chips ( fries) but be sure you can handle the chopped garlic if chosen.....it is strong !!!!
I've had the Royale with cheese pasty and it is a filling , well seasoned and savory experience! 
My girlfriend had the italian which she enjoyed.

The only complaint i have and one i have seen here before is the music. Really makes no sense with the atmosphere. I love 80s & 90 's music but it just doesnt seem to work here.l

EXCELLENT! I was referred by a friend in Tucson.  I had the take out for my family.  It  was interesting place when I went inside.  Not sure I would want to eat in there but I got the food home and it was unbelievably great ! The kids loved it :) Im a fan and plan on doing this again asap

This is my go to place for people not from AZ cause

1) you can only find in AZ
2) glorified hotpocket
3) really cool hipster place to eat.

I must have given the dobson and tempe location at least a couple hundred bucks. I will visit when I come back to AZ.
Been here many times. I always come back. Good beer, good pasties, good sticky date pudding

I wish we had this place back home! I'm now hooked on pasties! The hubs and I ordered the shepherd's pie and I got the chicken massala. It's a little on the expensive side and the portions aren't very big. We actually ordered a third shepherd's pie cause we were still hungry and it was so good! lol. The strongbow cider was also very delicious. We'll be going back here again next time we're in town.

My first visit and it was Lunch rush on a Friday. The wait was long but the food was hot and fresh. I ate the original and the steak was juicy, the potatoes soft yet firm and onions. What I really liked is the thin dough. I was expecting a bunch bread but it was nice the baked outer crust. Also tried the hummus and pita chips. That was so good, worth it!
I will be back, but not on lunch rush:)

Returned to Cornish Pasty this weekend. Wonderful service, food was DELICIOUS yet again. We had a Wells Banana Bread Beer and a Ballast Point Grapefruit IPA, they were wonderful. 

I had the Pepper Steak the first time, I can't recall on the second but both were outstanding. My girlfriend had the Pilgrim the first time and the Chicken Pot Pie the second time. They were to die for.

I highly recommend the Chocolate Butter Cake with ice cream, or the The Banoffe for dessert.

this place lacks atmosphere, but what it lacks there it makes up in spades when it comes to their pasties. I have never had such a good one before. Even if it's a drive to get there, you should go out of your way.
A friend of mine recommended this restaurant to me, so I went. It was fantastic! The food is great, and different! The atmosphere is also wonderful. It is close to my house so we'll be going often!

I had never had a pasty.I had heard of them but had zero expectations. My wife was less than enthused when I suggested we try it.

They had a Scottish Egg on the menu and I had heard of them and decided to try it. It was delicious!

We ordered a roast beef pasty and my wife ordered a chicken pot pie.

They were both delicious! We are now pasty converts! We will be back!

This is such a fun relaxed place to eat!! I always sit at the bar because I totally enjoy watching them prepare everything. Maybe my review won't be the best for most people checking this place out...but I have never actually had a pasty but have been here half a dozen times. So for those who are too scared of the pastys or don't see something they like or just want to check out something else on their menu...I must say, try the artichoke, bowtie pasta salad!! Its amazing! The dressing is great, as well as the spinach, pasta and feta! I have tried to replicate this at home..no success. So if you aren't the pasty type, try the salad!!

Four years later and it's really improved. I didn't even think I'd been to this one before until I saw my 2011 review. I really like the decor and the servers were friendly. Also, there wasn't a heat problem like I wrote about before (though it's a much cooler time of year). Good location, though the Scottsdale location is now my favourite with its amazing patio.

My first question... what the heck is a pasty??? A group of 8 of us sat outside on a Friday evening... the waitress was awesome, keeping up with our beers and everything :) I went with the safe choice, I think it was called "the Italian", but it was filled with marinara sauce and meat (maybe sausage and/or peperoni). It was very tasty- reminded me of a stromboli with a thinner, flakier crust. Next time I'll try something more adventurous, I swear :) I did have a bite of the bf's "lamb and mint sauce" pasty and that was very good too (I'm not a total food wuss... really, I'm not). 

Hoping to get back there again soon to try more of the menu!

Man alive, what a pleasant surprise of a new place for us. 

The food was excellent. Two people could easily share one dinner pastie. 

The Carne Adovada was hands down the very best we are, although the Spicy BBQ turkey was excellent as well!

We had no off-switch when there. We had their house chips with garlic and this hot chocolate toffee dessert dish that delighted my tastebuds.  

Super friendly service too!

Went there today for lunch with my husband, our baby girl and my brother-in-law. So good!!! I had the Greek Pastie, my husband had the Shepherd's Pie Pastie and the bro had the Pilgrim Pastie. All delicious, service was great, good beers. Can't wait to go back!

All I can say is WOW! It was my first visit but certainly not my last. I'm now a pasty fan (Carne Adovado & Italian). Luckily we arrived at 5:30pm as this place was packed by 6:30pm on a Tuesday! Several at our table had dessert and it too looked spectacular! Great variety of tap beer, up to 32oz., and our server was very attentive. Overall, exceptional experience!

pasty/past/
Noun: A folded pastry case filled with seasoned meat and vegetables aka AMAZINGNESS! Yes, amazingness is a word. A friend and I had decided to check this place out, and absolutely fell in love. I ordered the Spicy Asiago Chicken Pasty: Spicy chicken, roasted corn, black beans, asiago cheese, hatch chilies and mexican stewed tomatoes, with a side of sour cream and salsa. If you want to add a lil more heat you can request some sriracha. They have a great selection of wine (I'm partial to their Malbec) and beers and their happy hour is killer. 

The ambiance alone is pretty sweet as well. We sat at the bar, which is purely lit with candles. The tables are set with black church pews with candlight and dim lighting throughout. If it's a nice evening they have plenty of outdoor seating as well. Everyone that works there was soo chill and laid back. Made for a great evening ! 

Just hope next time I have enough room to try their dessert!

Delicious pasties!  OMG! You have so many choices it is hard to decide. My favorites are the Oggie and the Royale with Cheese, but you cannot go wrong with any of their other pasties... BTW, they are pronounced "past-ee."  Don't forget to order dessert! I like the Shirley Temple Pudding or the Chocolate Bread and Butter Pudding.  Although I am still open to try the other ones, especially their version of the Banoffee Pie (you can't go wrong with bananans, toffee, and cream).  Expect the inside of the place to be loud.  Although we have been there at odd times and it is pretty quiet.  The outside is pretty comfortable, even during summer or in the cold of winter (they have misting systems all over, and powerful, yet comfortable, heaters).  Their service is superb!  The servers friendly and fast.  Oh! Did I mention you can take unbaked pasties to go?!  Seriously!  Give this place a try.  You won't be disappointed. :)

One of my very favorite places!  Absolutely everything is delicious. Start with the potato leek soup - only a cup because you will be completely stuffed when you also get your beer and pasty but you must try it. AMAZING beer selection. I've had the tikka masala, the vindalo, the Cajun chicken , the porky, the bangers and mash, the salmon... The list goes on but not a single disappointing selection. If you have not tried this place,  GO NOW!

Hearty - Unique - Friendly
