Switch your evening routine of drive thru options or typical restaurant go-tos and have a sit down meal in a casual and warm setting. We arrived Wednesday evening at 10 PM and were pleasantly surprised with a low-lit, cozy environment. Service was attentive and hospitable. My boyfriend had the Pilgrim while I enjoyed the Lovely Bit a Salmon. It was decadent and filling - the perfect meal for a late dinner. The soft crunch of their made to order Signature Pastys is a necessity that can easily become addicting - don't short yourself with ordering anything else on the menu before you try one! Nothing as signature or authentic as a meal here.

I rated them just short of 5 stars because their Chocolate Bread Pudding tasted more of brandy than chocolate but if that's your booze of choice I definitely recommend it!
Oh Cornish Pasty Co, I wish I could eat you every day.  The more traditional pasties are great, as well as the Royale with cheese and the Chicken Tikka Masala one.

The main reason to miss a star is that the one that we ordered (the mint-lamb) was a bit dry to my taste and no mint to taste at all. For desert we had the apple one and that was much better. I'd like to try a different one some other time and compare :).

Good environment, and for groups, friendly staff who would explain you what they are cooking!!

What a treat. 
It's like having your favorite meal wrapped in a croissant and baked: totally reminds me of a childhood meal, hot pockets. 
I had the chicken pot pie; sometimes a consistent temperature is challenging.  
The broccoli and cauliflower w/cheese was also good.
Recently went to the Tempe location and they now serve sides as well. Yippee!

Woohoo! I finally got to try a Pasty! I've tried to go to the Tempe spot a few times, but it was either almost closing, so kitchen was closed, or lunch, too busy. But this weekend the 101 to our house was closed, so had to take a detour down Dobson, passed CPC, and yelped (do I get a prize for working that in?) at my husband to turn the car around! I've been trying to try this place for years, I pleaded. 

Boddingtons on tap makes me happy, the Pasty I chose was the asiago chicken with roasted green chili, double happy. Hubby had lamb with a mint sauce, he ate the entire thing, amazing, then had a big fat nap when we got home.

The interior is diner-like they do have much more seating than the Tempe spot (church pews with tables) and a patio at this location. I wouldn't mind coming back for a patio-beer day. Oh and the waitress did mention they might start doing brunch on Sundays soon, including mimosas and bloody marys.

Everything I have ever tried here has been delicious.  The atmosphere is always so calming and casual.  I love the decor and how they turned doors into tables with pews as seats.  Sometimes it does take a while to get recognized by a waiter or waitress, but that may also be because it is always so busy in there.  The one draft I wish they had is kiltlifter--- since it is a local favorite, they may see more people ordering it if it were on draft instead of in the bottle.

I love this place! I have been to the Tempe location just once and just realized that there's a location in Mesa! This location is much easier to find ( they have a pretty big sign out front) compared to the Tempe location which is more of a hidden gem. The food was amazing and prices are so reasonable. The owners have done a really good job with making sure they deliver consistent product between the two locations. I definitely recommend Cornish Pasty for a unique dining experience with great service and delicious food.

Delicious. Food comes lava hot. Mushy peas and scotch eggs were awesome. Kinda dark but I get the esthetic. Staff were fabulous and took the time to explain everything. Recommendations were on point. Price was reasonable too. Going back.

One of my favorite restaurants in Arizona.  I love the ambience both indoors and outdoors.  Beer is cheap and the pasties are fantastic.  If I ever have friends from out of town visit, odds are I am taking them to Cornish Pasty as it's a fun, casual restaurant that isn't too expensive, has a variety of fillings to satisfy anyone's palate, and you can hold a conversation despite it being pretty packed at times.

My number one pasty is the Pilgrim and I am known by my friends to swear by it.  I have never, ever been disappointed by the Pilgrim as it blends sweetness and savoriness wonderfully.  Other ones to fall back on are the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Royale with Cheese.  I also love the chips/french fries as an appetizer.  

Sitting at the bar is also fun as you can watch the chefs make the pasties and they are nice people!

Only cons are: small bathrooms, pasties always seem to take longer than I can bear to be ready to eat, and I am in a pit of despair when they sell out of the Pilgrim!

Love the ambience. We usually play a couple of pool games and spent at least an hour or two having dinner. Would have given a 5 but the amount of potatoes they are adding in the pasties made me give a 4 rating. 
Love the tandoori and jalapeo chicken bean soup. These are a must try!!!!!

We usually go to the Tempe location. This time, I think we just went on an off day at this location. We usually enjoy the Potato Leek soup, but it was way too salty so it was hard to get through it. We also ordered the Rosemary Pasty, and it just tasted off. Our waitress was very nice however and accommodating. Maybe we'll take a break before coming back and trying something else.

Cornish Pasty Co. Is a delicious adventure across the pond without leaving Phoenix. Tonight my sister and I had another great meal here. The service was only so so but the pasties are so good that I will give them a pass on service at least for now. We were originally seated in an area of the patio outside which we were told by the hostess, used to be a smoking area but they had recently turned it into a non smoking area. We really wanted to sit outside on this beautiful evening so we put up with the lingering smoky aroma and ash trays that were sitting on the table next to us. After we had ordered drinks, the table behind us proceeded to light up a cig. We were not to fond of this since we were told by the hostess that this was now a non smoking area. We decided to move tables since we observed that another nearby table, outside of the "smoking" area. We did inform our waitress of the move before we officially made it. I know that this is not necessarily the best thing to do in a restaurant setting because of the set up of waiter/ess per table or area but since we were mislead into believing that we were seated in a non smoking area, we felt it necessary to move.

Anyhow, our waitress did not seem to fond of the fact that we had moved and she rudely made the comment to us that and I quote "THAT IS THE SMOKING AREA" well I am sorry miss lady! We were told it was non smoking!! I would rather not be around cigarette smoke during my delicious pasty meal. I ended up ordering some Cornish coleslaw to start which was fantastic. It does have a fair amount of raw red onions in it, so be aware if you are ordering it on a date or a lunch break. It is more of savory coleslaw rather than sweet with hints of horseradish. I ordered the bangers and mash pasty. It was absolutely delicious! They do make their own sage sausage in house and it is oh so good! Mashed potatoes and sausage with a sage sausage gravy, YUM!! My sister had the chicken pot pie pasty and was equally impressed.

Overall the food is delicious. I have had many a pasty in England and these area equally as good if not better to some that I have had in around various cities in England. The service is hit or miss. I will be back for more because I love the food!
a great British pub. Highly recommend the Lamb Vindaloo and Chicken Tiki Masala. Both are wonderfully tasty. Great selection of craft beers on tap.

This place never ceases to amaze me. Met a family member here for dinner during a recent visit.  I could tell by the look on his face he was the unique decor made him suspicious of the place but I assured him the food was outstanding.  After having dinner my guest stated we had to make CPC a regular stop during visits. 

I love this place and only wish I lived closer.

I'm feeling bad about giving this place just an "A-OK" because of the many positive reviews.
I can't personally say I'm a huge fan of this place, so I can't give it four stars, but I will say that I will be visiting this place again.
The beer selection is really great and the mugs are worth a smile.
The atmosphere is "young and hip" and reminds me of a Scottish Pub I visited in the past.  The staff is truly nice and trying to be helpful.  Though we went at a weird time because our server changed in the middle.
The food though wasn't what I hyped it up to be, perhaps I set the bar too high.  The soup though was totally weird.  My sister and I ordered two soup; one was way too salty and the other was truly bland.  The Pasty itself wasn't bad.  I've never had a pasty and it tasted very well, Pasty.  The taste won't blow you away or cause you to over-eat, but it is fun to eat, and the non traditional pasties are worth trying.  The other thing we ordered was a lemonade.  That was pretty good.

Over all, the atmosphere was pretty good, but judging on food, it was a little better than okay and kind of interesting.  Oh, almost forgot, the food is truly very very filling.
We had:
Cottage Pie Pasty
Lemonade
Chicken Tikka Masala Pasty
Leek Soup

I went with my mother recently and she totally digs the food, and I found it more memorable than the first time, but the food still didn't blow me away, still, I'll be visiting again.

I grabbed a quick bite with friends on the way to the airport. I split a Shepherds Pie with a friend and we both devoured every bite. The beer was great too! We were seated in chairs that reminded me of church pews. The ambiance was casual and relaxed. I would definitely come back to try out more things on their menu!

Gah, so tasty. Bummed they were out of the bangers and mash pasty, but my second choice was damn tasty -- the table ordered Royale with Cheese, Pilgrim, Peppered Steak, and the Portobello Chicken, and everyone was more than satisfied. $9 average for the entrees was well worth it. 

Also, the chocolate chip cake was amazing. Dense after the meal, no doubt. But if you're sticking around to chat, you can definitely find room ;)

Solid beer selection, too.

I didn't know what to expect and was totally blown away! Great beer selection, and the food was fantastic. It was like a movie that you don't expect to be that great but becomes your favorite. I am looking for opportunities to get back to the East side of town so we can eat here again. (Come hungry, the portions are also large).

Love THE CAJUN with an order of chips with garlic and jalapenos.  

We've had the Royale, Rueben, Acovada and the Greek.  All good but I go back to the K JUN.

The Lentil soup is amazing too.  Wouldn't have tried it but saw someone here I knew and they recommended it.

The Banofee desert is awesome but have them heat it up or get it to go and nuke it for 30 seconds and it changes your life.  Without being heated it's still very good but heated it goes to another level.

Definitely the best food in Mesa! Original, delicious, and more choices than you could ever imagine... Pasty's is consistently satisfying! I can't recommend one specific dish because I've had 'em all and have a difficult time choosing one specific item. Just make sure you order a few side dishes because they really bring your meal together. And the chefs will make any item as spicy as you prefer! By far the best place to eat in Mesa!
Amazing! Fresh ingredients you watch them make your food in front of you. Tender flaky crust, a must try in Mesa.

Man I felt like I was over in England...or Ireland...or wherever this type of food is served. It was great food, service was great and the ambiance was spot on. Can't wait to go back. It's been a minute so i forgot what I had but I can tell you that bread is amazing.  The scotch eggs dude...perfect.

There are so few places worth the hype.. Cornish Pasty.. THE EXCEPTION.  The Pilgram is the Third Thursday of November in one bite.. Truly unique, and one of the most take you to a place, and time bites.. The decor, music, and the staff, really make this place work, The prices are right in line, and they have a real kick ass beer selection, I have read about spotty service, and I could see that being the case, but man... the food.. Probably the best meal under 10 bucks in the Copa.. Thanks CP!

Sat on the patio during dinner service. Server was very nice but her menu knowledge was seriously lacking. They didn't seem to give her the training she needs to be successful. We ordered two pasties after relaxing with our beers. It was relatively busy per usual on a Friday night, so the food took a little longer but we weren't stressed at all. Another server ran our food over (no issue there!) Unfortunately she only had my pasty and at that point in time let us know that the kitchen made the wrong one and asked if we wanted to try the one they made instead. (Not trying to be a pain and also being hungry we obliged.) Also knowing my girlfriend is some what picky I figured it wouldn't work out. Any-who she didn't like it so we ended up sharing mine, taking her original correct order Togo after having another beer. I like the atmosphere and food but FOH training needs to be stepped up. Communication is important and I'm guessing our order was either rang in incorrectly or the wrong food went out to the wrong table. Never saw a manager, the servers bought one of the pasties(had it comped later by the manager) Just packing service overall.

Wow, I was definitely impressed by this restaurant. I don't normally like pasties or pies that aren't sweet. And the English aren't exactly famous for their cuisine. But Cornish Pasty Co pulls it off so well. They've got your straight up traditional pasties with meat and potatoes, but they've also got some Italian or Mexican fusion pasties. 

Today, I got the Bangers and Mash - I thought I'd start out with something more traditional-sounding. Alex A. got the Chicken Alfredo. I liked mine better than his. The pasty crust was so moist and flaky - not at all hard and dry like what I usually get from pasties. My favorite part was the red wine gravy. It was AMAZING and totally pulled the entire pasty together. Alex's Chicken Alfredo, on the other hand, came with a marinara sauce, which I thought was too sweet/tomato-y. We also got a side of garlic/jalapeno chips, which actually means fries in British. They're super fresh and comes with the potato peels still on them. 

The restaurant itself was also really nice. It does have that British pub feel. I thought the service was a little slow, but that's only because we were in a rush. I also thought that the food was a little pricey for how much we got, but the taste definitely makes up for it.

I'll tell you what, my wife and I visit this Pasty on our special date nights at least twice a month. We could have special date night anywhere we like but we choose the Mesa Cornish Pasty, why? Is it the food, yeah it's delicious. Is it the atmosphere? That's nice too, but the main reason we visit is tabletouchin' Nessie, she's a lovely energetic lady that just brings a positive energy I'd swear it makes the food tastes better; goshdarnit if I don't leave here lovin' my wife even more. Thank you Nessie for being the hot dogginest best table toucher this side of the ol' Mississip'.

Came here the other night and it was very crowded. We were able to find a seat outside after the hostess told us it would be a 45-minute wait to get our food once we ordered. Ended up being an hour and 15 minutes from once we ordered.. Not really sure who our waiter was, we had several different people who were coming by. 

Food was great - my wife and I both loved our pasties and they were very filling. Curious to try the part-baked ones that you can take home and finish cooking. 

Service was subpar, partly because of how crowded it was the night we came, but I'd definitely come back and enjoy some tasty pasties.

I have been to Cornish Pasty twice in the past few weeks. The first time, I actually got a salad so I didn't get to try their famous pasties, however last night we came here with my family and spent more than 4 hours drinking, playing pool, darts, and of course eating! This time I got to try one of their pasty, I got the Chicken Tikka Massala and it was delicious. The puff pastry is very good, and everything tastes homemade! 
Our server (I do not recall his name, he had blond hair though) was very patient with us, especially when it was time to pay! 
Oh and did I mention that they have one of my favorite beer from Belgium  at only $5? LOVE IT

Stupid good!! Everything is made from scratch and fresh daily, including they're amazing soups!! Seriously the cream of leak soup is to die for and you can't go wrong with any Pasty... they're all amazing!! Why are you still reading this... GO ALREADY!!!

Went here for a birthday lunch with my husband.  Talk about some great pasty's!  I recommend trying The Oggie, The Shepherd's Pie, or the Bangers and Mash.  All three were delicious!  They even have an option to take some home with you...all you have to do is pop them in the oven for a little while.  I hope to go back soon...keep up the good work Cornish Pasty Company!
So happy we decided to try this! It was delicious and the staff was super nice. I got the bangers and mash pasty. The ultimate comfort food!

My husband and I really like coming here. Mushroom walnut spinach soup is fantastic but not consistent. Some days it's pureed (and it's the best) and others it's brothy and chunky (not great...). Kyron was our server tonight and he was awesome - gave us extra thick sliced of bread which made us very happy!

So if you would like a great restaurant experience with food that makes your taste buds sing.....this is the place!!!   This was our first time and Eric was the bartender, we sat at the bar, he was great in explaining everything and made the experience that much better...BUT then the food came and OH MY GOSH!!!  it was AMAZING!!!!  I ordered the Roast Dinner and my husband ordered the Bangers and Mash, we shared the meatballs...everything was so good and the portions were large..we cannot wait to go back!!

I live in Tucson and I absolutely love this restaurant!  I try and eat here every time we are in the city.  The food is AMAZING and the service is impeccable!!  They have a nice selection of wines and beers and everything is reasonably priced.  The pasties are so great and are huge and the desserts are excellent as well.  If you want a casual place that is simply great - you can't go wrong here!

Always good food at cornish pasty. 

I've been to their smaller shop over next to ASU.

This one definitely is a lot more of a refined atmosphere. I actually prefer the smaller one because it was very "divey".

If you want to have a more classy place to go to come to this location.

All in all if you haven't been to cornish pasty, or had one before definitely have to try at least once.

the one with lamb is the best.. (unless you don't like lamb, then i dont think you will agree with me)

I have literally been wanted to go to Cornish Pasty Co for 4 years - but we rarely travel to the SE side of AZ since we are in the very NW valley. Since we are moving to Gilbert we've been traveling down there to look at houses and finally we were able to eat at this establish meant

OMG was it super super good! My husband and I shared to Pasties: Meat and Cheese and the Chicken Pesto. 

There are no words for these delicious treats except yum yum yum! Not to mention we had a great server and many delightful dipping sauces (btw their thousand island was better than any i've ever had!)

We also had the Shirley Temple dessert - very tasty and a nice end to the meal

I'm sure we will be frequent visitors to this great place :)

Every location we've been to has been great - food, service, ambience. We only order the daily vegan pasty options and we love how the staff doesn't even blink (either because people order them frequently or the staff is well trained, or both). We also recommend the oven potatoes with garlic!

Cornish Pasty Company has been on our bookmark list for many years now. And thanks to multiple locations, we were finally able to give them a try.

Honestly, despite being raised by an incredibly British mother, I've never been a big fan of British cuisine. Chocolate? Yes. Food itself? Not really. But what's cool about Cornish is that, if you're not into the traditional meat/potato combinations, there's multiple alternatives available. Whatever you like, you're bound to find something that will work for you.

The restaurant itself definitely has a British pub feel to it, with its heavy wood and overall dark and dingy feeling. I was half expecting to see a fistfight breakout between two blokes arguing over their favorite football teams - and I don't mean the NFL.

We started with the scotch egg, which was far superior in quality to what I've had in the past. I opted for the Italian Pasty, which doesn't appear to be a common choice based on Yelp pictures. It consists of various meats and mozzarella, so I guess you could say it's somewhat similar to a heavily packed calzone. My girlfriend chose The Pilgrim, which includes turkey, onions, potatoes and stuffing. It's served with a side of cranberry sauce and some surprisingly high-quality gravy. Both pasties were excellent, using great-tasting ingredients that were wrapped in a fluffy and fresh shortcrust. In the end, we were both very impressed!

For dessert, despite all the online recommendations for the banoffee pie, we decided to go with the chocolate bread and butter pudding. This was excellent, having a nice, crispy outershell, while managing to be incredibly moist on the inside. The brandy flavoring was subtle enough to where it wasn't overpowering. It far exceeds many other desserts at its price point.

So, why not a perfect five stars? 

It's simple. We were uncomfortable the whole time. Like another reviewer mentioned, the place is incredibly hot, to the point where you end up feeling all gross and sweaty. Another review I saw revealed that their AC was out on one side the building, but they were continuing to seat people as if nothing was wrong. Yeah, perhaps a warning would be nice. No one wants to eat their pasties in a freaking sauna!

If you read the Yelp reviews, you'll see that most complaints stem from the shoddy service. Servers can be very slow and scattered about. No one really checked on us, so if we needed something, we usually had to struggle to get someone's attention. But they're clearly very successful, so I don't see them having the desire to improve in this area anytime soon. 

Overall, food wise, we were quite pleased with the offerings here and will definitely be returning in the future to try some of the other pasties available.

Like.  A lot.
The pasty selection is practically endless.
Oh man, I grew up eating this stuff in MI.  Went so long between having them so when we did it was a huge treat. 
But their variety wasn't something I had even heard about in MI.  Here they create the traditional and turn it up a few notches with some of their own creations.
And here they have a sauce on the side too.  It'a actually a gravy, with noticeable herbs and probably red wine too.  Its tasty stuff, but I think it actually takes away from the wonderful flavor of the pastie itself.

I really like the atmosphere here at this particular location. Granted I'm eating at the bar every time I've dined here so I'm not sure how I feel about the whole picnic table sort of seating which seems kind of communal. I really like the fact that you could come as a group and be together, as close as you want or as far apart as needed and still occupy just one table.  

It just seems kind of rustic in here with architectural elements that appear to have been repurposed.
It is dark, but not quite the envronment for an intimate dinner date.
Something about low lighting and dark wood makes it appealing.
Oh, and I can't forget to mention, they have expanded.  Like double inside from one of the last times we dined here.
And the patio area did likewise.  
This place must get crankin'
Two thumbs up for "well behaved canines" being allowed on the patio.  
Y'all know what that means, right?  
And kuddos to the two young ladies who had their well mannered dogs with them today.  

Beer selection is good.  I have always been able to get a draught that appeals to my palate.  
And I am NOT talking Budweiser, Miller or Coors.  I don't even know if they have those options available.

I encourage you to come during the slow part of the day, sit at the bar where you can watch the food prep.
You'll be entertained and educated about their pastie creations, and it might spark your interest to try something different next time.

You can't go wrong here. So many choices for beer, so many choices for food. Even the vegetarians will be happy. Always busy, so you know the food is fresh. Great place for a group gathering, call ahead to reserve  a section.
Food here is always great. Nobody else in Arizona has a menu like theirs. It is an opportunity to enjoy a real Cornish pasty. You will feel like you are in a real British pub.

Definitely one of my favorite local places.  The food is always amazing and the cheap car bombs always make it a fun time.  Both the Tempe and Mesa locations have their own unique charm and the staff is always great!

I came to this place while I was around town. And at first I really liked the atmosphere and the staff but I sat there for over 30 minutes and nobody served us. Even when I walk up to them and ask for our orders to be taken. Nobody came up to us and ask. We did not even get a glass of water overall. I have been a Foodie for a long time and had not been disrespected at a restaurant even when it was horrible food, it was not like they were busy or anything. I was terribly disappointed and I would never go back there again even when I am in town.

Last night, I enjoyed a wonderful meal and had a wonderful experience with one of the best waitresses I've ever had. (Devin) did an amazing job, had a wonderful smile and great attitude. I look forward to my next visit.

This was my first time trying a pasty and I am glad that I first had them here, based on the recommendation of a friend who favors this place. 

This place was jam-packed on a Monday evening! Their pasty menu is really extensive!! We were having a hard time trying to make a selection from among the wide range of premium & signature pasties. We finally decided to settle on the Lamb Vindaloo Pasty(for the Indian flavour) and the Chicken Pot Pie Pasty. 

For appetizers, we had the tandoori chicken wings - these were super oily, so much so that the waitress even gave us extra napkins to wipe off the excess oil.. eww! But I would give this appetizer a slight plus point for the spicy masalas coating the wings, that made it tasty. I just wish they had done a better job of marinating the chicken wings in the proper fashion before cooking them the right way(which's baking & grilling them and not deep frying!!)

The accompanying yoghurt mint sauce was what really caught our attention more than the chicken wings itself. Its super duper delicious!! The waitress who served us was very helpful in explaining the different sauces served here and she even brought us different samplers to try out during the main course.

The lamb vindaloo pasty was awesome, true to it's taste. If you are a lamb fan, you should definitely give this pasty a try. The chicken pot pie pasty was passable with a mixed blend of potatoes, vegetables and chopped chicken. It went well with the yoghurt-mint sauce and the tahini sauce.

Finally, it was desert time and once again we were at a loss to pick one among the various tempting choices on the list. The waitress once again poured in with her help, describing the best and the okayish desserts. If you are a toffee fan, the Sticky Toffee Pudding is the most delicious on the list.  They had also run out of the Chocolate bread & butter pudding that day since everyone seemed to be ordering it. 

We finally decided to give the Banoffie Pie a try. Beware!, the dessert is too much for just two people. We were full by the time we finished off half of the pie. The pie's crust was difficult to break and had a hidden layer of caramel cream within, which complimented well with the whipped cream. Aah, the whipped cream.. is well, not the lighter version, but a heavy thick cream that tastes almost like homemade butter. You can only have so much of that heavy cream. I wouldn't have it again.

I would give this place 4 stars for the food, 3.5 stars for the service. 3 stars for the ambience(they had good candle lighting all over, but if you prefer someplace quiet, then you should skip this place).

Abridged:
Meat. Cheese. Potatoes. In bread. Oh and Banoffee pie.

Unabridged:
This is my favorite Pasty location. First off, there is tons of space. Tons. The decor also has a nice relaxing but slightly sophisticated feel. And there aren't a million ASU students prancing about and hardly ever a wait in line when we head there for lunch. 

Vegetarian or not, there's always a pasty for everyone. Every time I've gone to either location, I've never gotten the same one twice, and I still have over 3/4 of the menu to clear off my list with most of them being ones I would love to enjoy. They're big enough that half the time I end up taking half home with me... though that's probably because I after trying the Banoffee Pie, I haven't been able to not order it since. So usually it's take half my pasty home and split Banoffee, which is the most heavenly dessert on the planet. 

All the items are made there, and if you sit at the bar/kitchen area you can watch them making them right there in the restaurant. It's kinda fun really. Sometimes I watch a little too closely if I know they're making a favorite, trying to figure out how I can mimic this masterpiece at home. Alas, I've always ended up failing. 

One thing to note is that while they make them there, they prep them in advance so you cannot substitute. However, I've been toying with the idea of calling a week in advance to have a special one made and paying up front so I can enjoy it a few days later.

So, back to this Banoffee Pie deal... I think I need to inform you in advance to save you from desperately trying to resist its allure when you visit due to this amazingly good review. So, it's a pretty awesome dessert. First, you start with a thick graham cracker crust. I am personally not a huge fan of graham cracker, but this isn't your typical crust like on a pie or a lemon bar. This looks like texas toast. For serious. Then add some homemade caramel, homemade whipped cream and bananas. This only adds up to a win.

My best friend chose Cornish Pasty Company for her birthday dinner.  The food was really good. I had the Lamb Vindaloo. It was a bit too spicy and I could have used some more of the sauce. I also had a nice hazelnut brown ale with it. The service left something to be desired. We did get refills of water and tea, but we had a hard time getting our server's attention when we needed something. There were long gaps between seating us, taking our order, refilling our drinks, taking our beer order, bringing us our beer, and getting our check. I tried to get help several times as we were eating, but couldn't seem to get anyone over to our table. There was also music playing pretty loudly, making it hard to have a conversation. I'd definitely order food to go, but not sure I'd dine in again.

Let me start by saying that the food is absolutely incredible. It's a unique idea for the area and it's executed well. The atmosphere is very pub like, and I think could make an excellent casual date spot or a great place to meet up with friends. 

So, why only 3 stars? The service. When I go out and I pay money for food and drinks, I'm paying a huge premium to be served. Unfortunately, this restaurant is lacking in that department. 

We came for lunch and it was our first time there. We were told to sit anywhere, which was kind of awkward because they have a ton of long tables and we didn't want to annoy anyone by sitting at the other end of one that was occupied. If we had been seated there by a hostess, it would have been less awkward. We found a spot at an unoccupied table and were greeted quickly by our waiter. We ordered, which included 3 pasties, a side, and a salad, but were then told that they were out of lettuce. That was a huge let down. When the food came out we noticed we were missing the side dish we ordered, but by the time we were checked on, we were already more than halfway done, so it was pointless to ask for it when it obviously hadn't been put through to begin with. Our drinks went unfilled and there was way too much time between check ins, so we couldn't even ask for refills.

Admittedly, these issues weren't egregious by any means, but it greatly decreased satisfaction in our lunch experience. I know they are probably going for a laid back pub like experience, but they need to get better wait staff that can offer that experience but still be on top of things. It was slow at lunch, so I hate to imagine how awful it would have been during a dinner rush. I miiight try this place again because the food IS delicious, and if that experience is better then I will update this review.

In a land of endless Chipotle and Red Lobster locations the Cornish Pasty Co is a true GEM! I stopped here while traveling for work from the Pacific NW and then it was well worth the hype (and the wait!)  I ordered the Greek Veggie Pasty and Curried potatoes my meal was sheer perfection!

So my cousin Dillon knows the history of this food but all I know it's tasty as hell and filling . So my cousin got the tomato soup for starters , huge like you can make a meal out of it. We both got the Mexican which is streak , onion and just a mess of flavors in this package of bread . 26.00 bucks for drink , 2 full entres and soup , great deal. The place is cool with a mix of couches and tables and a pool table and darts yep it's bar to folk. I liked it slot and you will like your Joe dirt waiters lol

I'm glad I joined Yelp today. If I hadn't, I wouldn't have seen mention of this place, and we wouldn't have had a delicious dinner tonight - or maybe we would have, but these people wouldn't have cooked it.

I enjoyed my meal here, as did my husband. I had their asiago chicken pasty, while he had the Mexican, with no sides. Even so, the meal was filling and flavorful. The atmosphere is fun, and not quite what I expected, with church pews and an industrial sort of feel. Our server was attentive. The only downside was that it seemed a little loud - not the music but the chatter of other people seemed to overwhelm the place. 

I'd like to go back and try their desserts sometime.

It was a little difficult to find this place - it's tucked away in a corner in the plaza right on the corner of Guadalupe and Dobson. We went right past it at first.

I need to update my review of this place badly.  I LOVE Cornish Pasty Company!  My only complaint is that there isn't one in Tucson yet.  YET!  A girl can dream.... but for right now I have to be happy that my husband will bring me one every time he goes to Phoenix to see his family, that I get them anytime I am in Phoenix, and that on my way to and from Pine, I can have a pasty.

I still love the decor, and the vibe this place gives off.  Punk rock music, candles in liquor bottles, large, wooden tables that sometimes need to be shared with other groups.

The service CAN be a little slow at times, but I attribute this to the fact that they have to bake your pasty when you order it, which is not the quickest thing ever.  I know exactly how long it takes, because when my husband brings them home, he asks to get them raw so we can bake them in our own oven.

They have vegetarian and even vegan pastys on top of their delicious meat-filled variety.  I have gotten a tremendous variety of pastys and I have yet to have one that i didn't care for.  I usually go for something vegetarian, but I DID have the Sheppard's Pie one last time and it was amazing.  

Cornish Pasty also has a large beer selection along with some ciders which is just delightful.  The servers know what beer I may want and always have helpful suggestions.

I am a big, big fan of Cornish Pasty Company.  It's always fresh and delicious, decent service, fun atmosphere and all at a good price.

What the heck is a Pasty??? Upon a friends recommendation, we gave Cornish Pasty a try. The food was amazing, the staff was efficient, friendly and attentive without being annoying and the desserts.... WOW. I usually don't have room for deserts, don't make this mistake, save room. The Shirley Temple pudding is not from this world. I am now a Pasty fan and will return for more culinary abuse. The only thing holding me back from 5 stars is the size of the dinning area. Although they have ample room on their patio, the seating inside is very limited. Most restaurants have enough seats so that as people finish, tables become available regularly. Here, there are 4 tables, so your wait time, if you want to eat inside, can be long. If you go before 5:30, you should be fine, if you go after 6, especially with 4 or more, prepare to wait. I myself will just go at 5:30, eat and be happy.
You must come here! Good beer list and an INCREDIBLE menu. Every time I've been I am torn on what to order. Check it out!

I had never been here, but kept hearing amazing things about it... So I went the other night with my friends... I was the last minute invite cause they thought I was already out, but I was told they hadn't been seated yet. I literally left right when he called me got there 5 min later and they had been seated. I think the waited 15 min for a table for 6 on a friday night, not bad at all
OK onto the food, I had the greek chicken flavor, and it was so tasty!! It came with taziyki sauce on the side that was so heavenly i wanted to lick the container it was in. My room mate had the spicy asiago chicken and he let me have a bite, and yummy! I must say though the flavors in the greek chicken one were seriously amazing, artichoke hearts... sun dried tomatoes just so good. 
I will be going back hopefully sometime soon. In the meantime  I  want a vat of the sauce to swim in at home

Lunch trip. The place was mostly empty, I imagine it's a bit more happening during the evening. They have a full bar with plenty of drink options, great brews on tap. Never having a pasty before, I went with the safe choice and selected the cottage pie (shepard's pie with ground beef instead of minced lamb). They bake to order, so the freshness is off the scale here. In fact, sip on your drinks a bit longer as the food is piping hot when it arrives. Our server was extremely nice and helpful with the menu items. 

I thought the pastry was excellent- flaky, fresh, baked just right. The interior was bland. I had to add several shakes of salt and pepper to get a little more flavor from it. Also, the red wine gravy that came on the side was not for me. It just had a peculiar taste, although the server said it was very popular. The prices were good, around $10 for any pasty and a couple bucks for a soda.

I'd like to visit CPC again during the evening and take advantage of the large outdoor patio. I'd bet the right pasty pairs really well with a cold pint of IPA or Guinness. I would try something a little more adverturous next time around, but definitely want to come back.

I absolutely love this place. The price may seem high until you get down to eating the servings. I am a big guy and can easily put away a lot of food but I even have trouble finding room for this. The pasties are not a meal you can leave in a company fridge for long because someone will seal it. It is that good. Everyone I have ever taken to eat there has said at first the food can be a little rich for their taste but by time we leave they all tell me that they have found their new favorite eatery, that is saying something since a lot of the people I have brought over are from New York or Europe. On a further note there is a wide selection for almost anyone vegetarian included, the tea drinker, or even the ones of us that would like a little beer with our meal. Best of all $3 Irish Car Bombs for the win! I recommend this place to anyone, take your time meet the staff (most of them are heavily tattooed and/or pierced but they are great people kind and friendly and not just because they are paid to be).

when i ordered an Oggie with ketchup, the waitress said, "ah, you're from Michigan then."  why yes, yes i am.

these pasties are good.  i would take one from up north over these any day, but not by much.  they also have a bunch of other kinds of pasties (not really pasties, more like pasty-inspired foods) for the more adventurous.  it's the Oggie for me though.

We were meeting some friends here for dinner. After arriving early we decided to grab a few drinks at the bar and wait. The bartender was friendly enough and well informed about all the beer selections. We also eyed the pool table and decided we will come back one night just to play a few games. About 15 minutes later our friends arrived and we had a seat. Everything was went smooth until our server decided to start talking politics. Ugh. He mentioned how Trump's favorite drink was the Moscow Mule and went on a semi-rant about how awful Republicans voters are. This indeed offended at least 2 people in my group who are indeed Republicans. It was a bit of a bummer that our night had to become awkward and ruined because this waiter assumes everyone thinks just like him. If we do return to Cornish Pasty again, it will be to another location so we don't encounter this guy. Too bad because the beers were large and cold and the food delicious.

Arizona staple! As az natives we ALWAYS make it a point to stop by for a pasty and maybe 10 half baked to take home to Cali! Staff always friendly; especially Kristina. Looking forward to our next phx visit

The one located in Tempe is always less packed but same as awesome as the Scottsdale location. Ask for seasonal beer list (great beer). My boyfriend, cousins, and sisters love it here. The top choices always tend to be the carne adovada and Italian pasty but the chicken pot pie is also great. 

The environment of a speakeasy inside and outside is very calm and easy too. Great place to go with coworkers, family, friends, etc.

I wish I could give them more stars.  I eat here every chance I get and have never been disappointed.  The service is always great and everyone is SO friendly.  And the portions are huge.

I have only tried about half of the items on the menu because it is huge.  Everything I have tried was great.  I have eaten Cornish pasties in England many times and these are as good as any I ate there.

I see everyone raves about the red wine sauce but I don't care for it.  It is not needed and only detracts from the flavor of the pasty.  I was impressed that they had HP sauce, which I love, but it too does not work with pasties.

Prologue:
My fiancee and I were discussing where to go for our weekly Saturday evening dinner date and she said she was in the mood for some protein.

I looked through some places in our area, which I had recently bookmarked based on reviews from my fellow Elites. I recommended this restaurant and it turned out to be just what she had in mind.


The Plot:
We started by sharing the Blinkin Heng salad, which was followed by a Shepherd's Pie Signature Pasty and a Lovely Bit a Salmon Premium Pasty, and finished with a Sticky Toffee Pudding.

This was the first time for both of us to try this type of cuisine and it was a welcome learning experience.


The Scene:
The Blinkin Heng included a pleasing assortment of roasted turkey, greens, fruit, nuts, cheese, bacon (which we requested to have on the side), and hard boiled egg with just the right amount of white balsamic dressing.
They kindly split the order into two portions, which was plenty for each of us, and we also appreciated the care that went into to the presentation.

Judging by how flaky and perfect the pasty crusts were, my impression is that they were freshly baked just prior to serving. The contents were also nice and warm when they arrived at our table. My conclusion was that one advantage of preparing pies in a manner similar to a turnover, rather than using a pie tin, meant they could be baked more quickly like a calzone.

The Shepherd's Pie pasty was made with ground lamb along with mashed potato and the usual pot pie veggies and was served with a side of red wine gravy. There was just the right amount of mashed potato surrounding the other ingredients, the lamb was seasoned perfectly for me, and the veggies were firm yet tender. This pasty reminded me of Scaciatta, which is an Italian meat pie that is sometimes made with lamb and something I enjoyed many times when growing up in New England. Consequently, this turned out to be a genuine comfort food experience for me.

The Lovely Bit a Salmon pasty was stuffed with plenty of marinated salmon, a white wine and cream dill sauce, sauted asparagus, garlic roasted tomato, spinach, and red potato. This pasty reminded me of the type of traditional salmon pie you might find in a northern European country such as Lithuania and it was comparable in quality to the Shepherd's Pie pasty in every regard. My fiancee was completely satisfied with this dish, as any fellow salmon lover most certainly would be.

My fiancee and I place a great deal of importance on the experience of finishing a meal with a delicious, satisfying, and memorable dessert.
The Sticky Toffee Pudding we ordered definitely fit the bill. There was plenty of of cake to share, it was warm and moist when it arrived on our table, and the texture and consistency was was like a cross between a brownie and molten chocolate cake, which paired very well with the vanilla ice cream, of course.


The Rest of the Story:
The decor was exactly what you would expect at a restaurant with the word Cornish in its name.
My fiancee especially liked the wine bottle candle holders on each table.

We were seated right away on a Saturday evening and the staff were courteous and friendly.


Epilogue:
The overall quality of the food easily deserves 3 stars. At first we were a bit hesitant to award a 4th star due to the tab for dinner being a little pricey. However, considering the fact that everything was very good along with the relative uniqueness of this type of cuisine we decided that it was worth it.


Photo Design:
by Billie Z.

OK, so this was the absolute bomb!

Came in from out of state and met a friend here. Twas a late lunch, and crowds had died down, so the outdoor seating was conducive to just hangin' out and chillin' for a chat. 

Ordered a stout beer (can't remember the name/brand), and it was GOOOOOD. Accompanied that with the following -

Carne Adovada $11.00
Simmered pork in New Mexican red chili stew, Mexican rice, hatch chilies and cheddar. With a side of sour cream and salsa.

...and I thought it was super smooth and super good. Really well-balanced in flavor and texture. 

Life is great!!

Meh. Not too impressed. Ordered the asiago chicken pasty and garlic oven fries - they were nothing to write home about. This place is also not very kid friendly, in my opinion. Probably won't go back.

For those who are not familiar with this british speciality, a cornish pasty is a sandwich baked into a pie-like crust.  It's a lot of like a hot pocket, except it's good.  And this restaurant serves up an amazing cornish pasty.  It also doesn't hurt that Cornish Pasty Company has an authentic british pub ambiance.

I had the Oggie, which is a pretty traditional pasty.  Steak, potatoes and onion.  Give it a minute before taking your first bite.  Trust me when I say it comes to the table piping hot.  For just $8.50, it's a pretty good little meal.  Need more?  There are some good sides and salads for about $2 to $5.  The beer selection (tap and draft) is awesome.  I did not partake in dessert, but what I saw at other tables looked amazing.
Great food, but you have to have a designated amount of time blocked off to eat here.

I came out for a friend's birthday in December.  I had never been or heard of this place before.  So, I go and find a small place with a patio and a bar.  :-)

Pasty kind of reminded me of a really large hot pocket type deal.  I didn't eat anything while I was there, but the place sure did smell amazing.

We drank though.  Irish car bombs!  I'm not a fan of them, but the birthday girl sure is!

I don't think I'd drive back to Mesa just to go here, but if you live in Mesa and are looking for something different...you might like it.

yes I am a fan- and this is yummy. 

Creative assortment of dough pockets filled with yummy.

Recommend for groups or even a cheap date.

Cornish Pasty Company
1941 W. Guadalupe Road
Mesa, Arizona

We arrived on a Friday night at 6:00 as a party of 14. Probably not the most fair thing to do since I knew I was going to review the restaurant, yet it didn't phase them in the least. While they take no reservations, they treated us courteously, and seated us after a short wait.

This is not the quietest place to eat at, as a lot of it has to do with the bar, which is very conducive to friendly chit chat, but overlooking that, it's quite a charming place. There is seating outside, as well as in church pews inside, which makes for a cozy atmosphere as well as the possibility of having new conversations with people you have never met - something that Americans are not used to, but is very common in the rest of the world.

Everyone ordered soft drinks except for myself. I ordered a Strongbow to see if it was what I remembered from the U.K., and it was no different at all. A true hard cider with good flavor of apples.

For my main course, I ordered the Oggie, a mixture of steak, potato, onion and rutabaga, served in a pastry crust with a small cruet of red wine gravy. ($8.00) . I was instantly transported back to the U.K. with my first bite. It had great depth of flavor, and the red wine sauce was absolute dynamite. An excellent dish! I also ordered a side of Mushy Peas ($2.75) and a side of Baked Beans ($2.50). The peas had nice flavor and were exactly as served in England, but I didn't care for the Baked Beans. There seemed to be an odd flavor associated with them that was off putting and which everyone agreed was not very tasty. 

Other members of our party ordered the Italian, the Porky (pronounced as orgasmic), the Shepherds Pie, the Reuben (good corned beef), the Chicken Greek (said to be very tasty), and the Lamb Vindaloo (usually very spicy, but apparently toned down here for American palates). Two of our party ordered the Pilgrim, which is roasted turkey, sweet potatoes, grilled onions, stuffing and red wine gravy. One pronounced it terrific, while the other didn't care for it.

The menu also includes a nice assortment of vegetarian dishes as well.

Most people didn't have room for dessert, but a few did, with almost everyone sharing. One of the desserts was Banoffee Pie - a graham cracker crust, homemade caramel, whipped cream and fresh bananas. It was interesting to note that the whipped cream was unsweetened. When mixed with the other ingredients, it picked up it's sweetness from them and tended to tone down the overall sweetness of the dish - a wonderful idea of what would otherwise have been an overly sweet dessert.


The other dessert that was ordered was the Apple Caramel Pasty - a kind of apple turnover pie crammed full of apples and cinnamon and covered with a homemade caramel sauce and served with a large scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream. Nothing could have been better, especially since the caramel wasn't too sweet.

Considering how crowded the place was, service was not too bad, and certainly could have been a lot worse.

Perhaps the only fault I could find was with the ladies room. The paper bin was full to the top, and the rolls of paper were scattered around instead of being in holders. I have been in nicer restrooms in other restaurants.

Overall, this was a wonderful eating experience, with several authentic dishes on the menu as well as some creative ones. I recommend it highly and give it 4 stars.

Oh my Gaaawwwd. Kicking myself for not trying the Cornish Pasty Company sooner! This is a Mesa (or Tempe) "Must-Try"! 

My Dude and I have been here twice now. Reasonably priced delicious food, a wide variety of brews and attentive service all make it a great experience here. 

There's a hipster vibe going on, but that's not a bad thing. We like to joke that this place could pass for one of the pubs out of Harry Potter.

It's dark inside, with empty liquor and wine bottles being used as candles. Another great touch to the great ambiance. 

The first time we went, we got a table up front. 

Picky Eater Advisory: It should be noted that the Pasties are cooked to order, but you can't add or subtract ingredients. 

Also, be prepared to wait a while. Good food takes time! Just grab a beer and enjoy your company. 

Tried the Lamb Vindaloo and the traditional Oggie pasties. Both were absolutely delicious! Tender lamb, and the spices used weren't too overbearing, but I was sweating buckets. Which my Mexican thought was hilarious. Damn you, Dude. 

Love that they can wrap the other half of your pasty in foil to take home instead of boxes. 

We also tried the oven chips with jalapeo and garlic. Cooked to perfection, but not overcooked. Don't feel like the jalapeos contributed much and probably wouldn't add them again.

The last time we were here, it was crazy busy, so we sat at the Pasty Bar (not to be mistaken for the actual bar)! Change it up sometime, it was cool to watch the pasties being made. 

We got the Bangers and Mash and the Cheeseburger Royale pasties this time. Again, both great. 

Our waitress forgot to put in our order for oven chips, and was awesome enough to comp it from the check. 

Downside to the Bar? You can come across groups of people telling you to "move over" so they can fit their group together. Rude and annoying if you just got your Pasties, but this time not a huge deal as we were about to get our check and leave.

There's so many Pasties to choose from, which makes things overwhelming when it comes time to order. 

Look forward to working my way through their Pasty offerings and bringing my family and friends here for brews, good food and good times!

Fabulous!! Found this place on yelp & it looked like a place my whole family would enjoy.  It was a lot busier than we anticipated, but the hostess was very nice & it wasn't too long before we were seated.  Our waitress was pleasant & efficient. 
Our pasties were so good!  I had the spicy chicken with black beans, asiago cheese, corn & tomatoes.  My husband had meat & cheese, and my kids had the Royale, chicken pot pie & the Pilgrim.  Each one was perfectly done. 
We ordered two desserts, and to be honest, we didn't love either one.  The chocolate bread pudding was too strong of a brandy flavor for me, and the other one - some graham cracker Carmel banana thing - was too heavy on the whipped cream with not enough Carmel.  But the beer list was good & the atmosphere was fun, so I'm giving a 5 star anyhow. Now we just need one of these places in San Diego!

A fancy hot pocket made with fresh ingredients in a wide selection of choices. They don't do custom orders, your pasty comes as is. I've tried a bulk of them, but the cajun chicken continues to be my fav, it's just spicy enough. Sunday is all day happy hour and the beer selection is pretty nice too. I only wish they had a hostess, almost every time I go there, I've been sat at a table that had more people coming so my group wouldn't fit.

OMG! OMG! OMG!!!
I'm a Brit living in California, and my boyfriends son lives in Tempe (ASU graduate....SUN DEVILS!!!!) and we came out for a visit this weekend.
I was bored at work a couple days ago, so Yelped "British bars in Tempe, AZ" and this place popped up. After reading the reviews, and telling my boyfriend I wanted to try this place out, the 4 of us (boyfriend, his son and son's girlfriend) went for dinner tonight.

The place was packed - always a good sign. We got seated straight away, though. Our server was attentive but not obtrusive, and got us started on our drinks while we perused the menu.

Please note above - I'm English, a genuine Brit! I was very impressed with the menu. I haven't seen a scotch egg in years! They serve scotch eggs!!! And mushy peas!!! 
I opted for the chicken tikka masala pasty, as I love curry. Holy crap, batman, that thing was HUGE!! WE also ordered a side of their oven chips, which are like proper English chips (fries, for the uneducated) and a side of gravy.

They have a huge selection of pasties, and the prices are totally within reason. I will definitely be coming back to this place when we come out next month for ASU vs Washington State.

SUN DEVILS!!
(P.S., the game was terrible, we got slammed)

Well I've been going to the location in Tempe for years and have nothing bad to say about Cornish Pasty. Their food is second to none and I always bring out of town visitors to Tempe and they love it. 

Well first time making it to the Mesa location. Really nice building, I see they still have the long bench settings but the overall restaurant appeared bigger and more open. Still same great food. My personal favorite is the Meat and Cheese and I usually try to take a bite or two from my wife who usual orders the pilgrim or Italian. All are great!!!

Good service as well, I forget our server name, but she was very nice and food came put prompt and was very attentive to our party. 

Overall a good addition to the Cornish Pasty restaurants. I can't wait till I get a chance to checkout the scottsdale location next so I can complete my Cornish Pasty visits.
I love this place! The food is great the staff is knowledgeable and friendly. I have not had a bad experience yet!

Wow the food is amazing! It has his selection of vegetarian and vegan meals. I got the mock chicken Asiago spicy one and my partner has the bbq one. We both loved it. Even their fries are delicious. The atmosphere in here are very inviting and cozy. I sediment highly recommend you to give this place a try! I certainty will take our friends here.

I've never had a British style pasty but this place offers a unique twist on it aside from the traditional ones. Make sure you come hungry and have an empty stomach, these pasties will satisfy your hunger.

I ordered the Spicy Asiago Chicken which was an Awesome flaky, buttery pastry type crust stuffed with chicken, asiago cheese, black beans, hatch chiles, roasted corn, and tomatoes. The crust was thin, flaky, and buttery that seemed to defy how it could itself together with all those fillings. I appreciate that it wasn't doughy like other types of stuffed pastries, strombollis, calzones, etc. and it seemed to strike the balance between the crust and the fillings.

Although it may be typical for a pasty be aware of any of the ones that have potatoes as part of the filling. I tried their version of the chicken pot pie and my taste buds only remembered the heaviness of starch and more starch with the crust and roasted potatoes and the chicken seemed to be lost in all that. 

I was kind of bummed they ran out of oven fries. I was looking forward to that.

Overall, a very unique and delicious experience.

My friend just bought a house dangerously close to this place. I've been 3 times in the last 2 weeks, and I live 25 miles away. I love this friend, but her proximity to magical pasties may be contributing to my frequent visits. I've sat at the bar, at a church pew table inside, and at a booth outside under the misters (during the short-lived reprieve from this heat). The bar is cool, you can watch the kitchen staff weigh out the pasty ingredients and craft those life-changing vessels of goodness. And get second, third, and fourth carbombs rather quickly. Which, by the by, are $3. All. The. Time. I've sampled many a pasty, as I've usually been with a group. Have to say the Carne Adovada has by far been my favorite, with the Royale with Cheese coming in at a close second. Mmmmm Thousand Island dressing, hello! The decor is pretty awesome, understated. Definitely, definitely, definitely do the Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert. It will not disappoint.

Had an amazing lunch here today. Tried the Lamb Vindaloo Pasty with mint yogurt and loved it. For dessert had the Sticky Toffee Pudding which was unbelievably tasty : ) I liked the cozy atmosphere, the great beer selection and even the music : )  The staff are super friendly and helpful. Looking forward to the Scottsdale location which I hope opens soon!!!

Best advice - eat before you come here. We waited over an hour for our food on a night that was not at all busy. Our waitress disappeared after taking our order, and we never saw her again. After a while, another waitress asked us if we'd ordered, and I said that we had, a long time ago. She checked and said it would be out soon, but didn't apologize for the long wait.

We both got bangers & mash, which apparently come pre-made, so we were perplexed as to why we had to wait so long for it. And because they come pre-made, it is not possible to just get the bangers and mash separately (without the glutinous pasty shell). So I had to dig the contents out, finding that there was precious little contents compared to the pasty. What was there was good, complemented by the red wine gravy that other reviewers have raved about.

The salad and chips (steak fries) were very tasty, and the lemonade was very lemony. The ambiance was nice, with the pub lit by candles dripping over wine bottles, and new age cello music seeping out of the house speakers.

Will I come back? Perhaps, if I'm not that hungry and can wait an hour for the food to arrive, and if I want to make a meal out of gluten-free side dishes. I came here with a craving for bangers & mash, and will keep looking. There *have* to be good ones on this side of the pond.

How can you not like Cornish Pasty's? This place is amazing. Every location is amazing. All the food is amazing.

AMAZING

More seriously, I do go to their locations all the time. The one I end up at the most is the Dobson/Guadalupe location. I love the decor. Church pews are great seats. The place is always packed with a pretty friendly crowd. The jukebox has some really excellent music. The food of course is nomalicious. I highly recommend all their hand crafted soups. I've never had a pasty I didn't like. Of course, also save room for some dessert. The caramel pasty and the pavlova are both killer. The pavlova was so good I went home and learned how to make them so I could have them even when I didn't feel like putting on pants. Sadly, sometimes the desire to not put on pants even outweighs the desire to eat at a place this amazing.

Holy cow this place is awesome.
Food is amazing! 
Came here for lunch with my husband and we sat outside because there were a lot of business people inside and a bit dark and my son needed to do homework.
We sat outside and it was great.  Our server was awesome-professional, fast, and he really knew the menu, beers were delish, waters got refilled before we even finished, and the food???!!!! Out of this world. 

Only reason giving 4 stars is that they were out of 3 of the ones that we wanted.
But what we got was still really good! 
Definitely going back!

My dinner was absolutely fantastic! I had the shepherds pie pasty which was extremely delicious. It was nice and hot coming out and smelled amazing. The environment is a little dark...but it is a bar so I guess that is what you'll get ha. Will definitely be back!
very good pasties my grandmother made these too and they have that grama taste and the desserts everytime ive been here its been great

I have heard so much about this place!   The reviews.  My co-workers and my kids rave about this place.  I really wanted to like it.  Atmosphere is great. Huge assortment.  We got our food and first bite was ok.  It was luke warm.  Mind you the place was not busy early evening before  dinner with a long wait for the food to come. THe second bite was not as warm.  The third bite was cold.  Not just cold but soggy mush cold. Some food can be eaten cold.  Pizza, Fried Chicked.  This just flat out turns you off and ruins your taste buds.  The staff after 10 minutes of trying to get them away from staring at their cell phones and the group conversation at the bar.  They blankly look at you and say,  "do you want us to heat it up?"  We were turned off. Its like reheating leftovers.  THey sent a couple home with us and we paid for our beer.  Been to several pasty places. I love them! They keep them in the oven with a much smaller choice range. So when you get they are baked throught out, hot and feel like a meat pie should taste.  Its all about quality control

Went on a recommendation from a local (we are from (Iowa - the Cyclone State).  All I can say is "Fabulous"!  We had chicken pot pie, a chicken Pesto, and a salad.  All great and the atmosphere is so inviting too.  I'd guess this place is very busy at most times.  If they ever want I expand, I'd recommend Iowa - they would kill it here $$$$$$$!

Delicious food, awesome music, great beer selection, and awesome overall setting and staff.  You can't go wrong here!  Happy hour, dinner, lunch, anytime and anything on the menu is sooo good!  Very original music on the jukebox you won't hear anywhere else.  I love this place!  The cajun chicken pasty and the pasta salad (among many others) are favs!  Vegetarian options are plentiful :)

Great food, great beer. Food is made fresh! I had the lamb vindaloo pasty. Also ordered garlic jalapeno chips. My daughter had mashed potatoes, she loved those too! Wonderful, cozy feel in the place too. Love the candles in the liquor bottles.

All the food was great. We had a large table of 8 people. Nobody had anything they didn't like. There were a few issues though.

- They were out of 4 different things we tried to order (mainly appetizers)
- They brought out the leek soup and said "the bread crumbs are still cooking, but we will bring you a second complimentary cup of soup to make up for it" Well they didn't bring out the 2nd cup, we had to ask for it. The 2nd cup didn't even have the bread crumbs, AND we got charged for the second cup.
- For being a large group, they accommodated pretty well, but their social skills could be turned up a notch. We were obviously there for a birthday (lots of gifts and bows)...wouldn't most servers say "Is it someone's birthday?"

Music was pretty loud too, definitely wasn't expecting that. Overall, pretty good though. Very filling pasties.

My husband and I went here on a whim one night. I loved the atmosphere, gave you an european romantic feeling. The bartender was friendly amd her drink were beautifully made. I left a little wobbly but it was def a great nighy out with my love. As far as the food goes it was delicious.

Walking in from Sunny AZ into a dimly lit pub.  A rather large Pub.

Great ambiance and atmosphere with friendly service and almost a nostalgia of the past.

The pies have a heavy skin with a nice crust.  The fillings are rich and bold in flavor.

Scotched Egg was perfectly cooked and flavored with a great crust.

Perfectly chilled Guinness to bring it all together.

Seems like there was only 1 friendly server for about 10 tables.  This did slow things down a bit but overall happy here and will be back to try more of their menu.

Food is good service is so, so or bad.  Normally I get the chicken tika masala and it is yummy but i tried the steak and rosemary. It was really unappetizing.  I ate about 2 bites and that was to much.  I asked the person I was with to try it and they agreed. Both times I've tried eating at the restaurant the servers are less then stellar. If you do try here stick with the to go.

yes, it is 5 star blow your knickers off good. In fact, read Brian S.'s review because he lays it all out as to why this is such a heavenly spot. All I will add - lamb and mint pasty with a kroenenberg beer...Tuck in!

Superb.  I have not met a pasty I didn't like here.  Oggie, veggie oggie, lamb vindaloo, carne adovada, etc., and the list goes on, and will continue to grow as I eat my way through the menu.  This is a great place for vegetarians as well since they use Quorn and faux ground beef.  My veggie oggie was almost indistinguishable in taste from a regular oggie.  Dessert is also excellent.  I've had the apple caramel pasty and it was the perfect way to end our meal.

This is a must-eat-at restaurant.  Plus, with enough happy hour car bombs ($2 after 10 PM, and from 3-5 PM), you can giggle inwardly (or outwardly) at the thought of eating something called "pasty" (yes, even though it really is pronounced Pass-teee).

I can't even think of one bad thing to say about this place. Everyone is really friendly. Major hipster vibe. The service was fast and they fill you up with amazing bread while you wait. (You can buy a loaf to take home) The food is absolutely on point. There are many options and every one of them looks delicious. The desserts are amazing. Not really feeling the church pew seating but its easy to overlook when everything else is perfect.

Cornish is great for anyone who loves bread and beer. They have a great staff who always remembers you, they aren't trying to sell you things you don't need. The staff recommends wonderful Items you can sit at the bar or table. The staff is always laughing and talking with eachother but still completely on task and happy to see you. I like this location very much.

My friends and I really enjoy coming to Cornish Pasty Co. We've only been to the location on Dobson. The food is delicious and very reasonably priced. The spirit there is so friendly and helpful. If you don't know what to order the waiter/waitresses always do an excellent job with recommendations. The food is always delicious and super filling!

Told us to take any table. We did. No one came. I like their food that I've gotten from other locations. We sat waiting for a bit while multiple servers passed us, looked at us and no one addressed us or served us. We left.

Food is great here and the atmosphere is pretty good. Portions are pretty decent, I think we all had some left over. 

Only gripes are that the benches we sat in we're terribly uncomfortable and the place was so loud we could hardly talk. Otherwise it was pretty good.

Service/food/ambiance = 3.5

On my first dinner here, I had a vegan pasty. The filling was good, but the pastry was dry and overdone. The plus? It's a large portion; if nothing else, I left with a full stomach. On my second dining experience, I wanted a lighter meal. I ordered the mushroom, walnut and spinach soup, with a Greek salad (no feta). The soup was flavorful, creamy, and well made. It came with sturdy bread that was perfect for soaking up the deliciousness. The salad came with a pesto dressing that was also tasty; as expected, the salad ingredients themselves were ordinary. Pieces of both meals I had here were well done, but they were still lacking in flavor and attention. Those with me ordered the vegan Mexican pasty. They both really enjoyed it. 

They have a decent drink selection so definitely look that over. I ordered the Union Jack. Refreshingly light with a bit of tang, hint of sweetness, and a hefty ABV. 

The servers bleed the hipster laissez faire attitude. Take from that what you will. Lastly, bathroom could be cleaner.

My wife and I came here with our good friends who are English.  They told us how authentic it is and told us about the history of the food.  Really cool stuff!  When we showed up it was great food and the history of the food was throughout the whole restaurant.  Lots of old pictures of tin miners.  We loved the hearty food and the great atmosphere!

Delicious and much healthier than most "bar food".  Lamb Vindaloo was really excellent, tender and actually spicy and authentically curry.  I liked that the crust wasn't super heavy, but a thin shell.  The yogurt dip was good, too.  My husband said his potato soup was also quite delicious.  We both enjoyed the banoffee pie, although the crust was overbaked and too hard, but I just scooped up everything else and left the crust alone.  Hibiscus tea was good and refreshing.

Customer service was friendly but spotty.  My waitress was okay, but some of the others were mostly talking to people and not working, leaving the others to pick up the slack.

Solid food and beer.  Basically everything is stuffed and baked inside a pastry.  Like super beef wellingtons!  We had the Indian one, the southwest one, the steak one, and a veggie one.  The veggie was a little heavy on the cheese, but the others were just right.  Sauces were acceptable but not spectacular.  Overall, solid.
Was really good the first time we came however the second time fell way short of expectations!!cool atmosphere food was okay really good the first time not sure if They had different cooks or what!!

When I'm really craving meat and want to splurge I go here. It's that unhealthy meat and potatoes comfort food without the guilt of eating an animal, I can only speak to their vegan vegetarian options. Their pub fries are so tasty with jalapeos and garlic and they are oven baked and better than fried. Oh and their deserts are so good you may cry tears of joy. I don't eat out much but when I do and get to pick I happily pick this lovely spot with a fantastic beer selection and nice vibe/ atmosphere. Service leaves something to be desired but quality of food is what I care about.

One of my favorite places. Have tried the Lamb & Mint, Lamb Vindaloo, and Chicken Tikka Masala pasties. All were delicious and filling. For desert, the Shirley Temple Pudding is a must!

Love the concept of an open kitchen and the eclectic  decor; it's a nice cross between a modern and tavern-like feel. 

It's always crowded during dinner, but usually not too long of a wait.

Side note: they always play great music.

Love grabbing a big, cold glass of crisp cider (Strongbow on tap) with any kind of hot, crusty pasty I'm in the mood for: traditional hearty, zesty Indian, spicy Mexican, healthy! A little pricey, but quality ingredients! Excellent patio. Fantastic for monsoon watching and easily accessible from canal bike path.
Order the chicken tikka masala pasty with jalapeo/garlic fries and a side of the spicy pepper soup :)

Notice to restaurant staff: If you screw up and order, just quickly do something to make up for it.

Cornish Pasty prepared a cheesesteak pasty when we asked for a Mediterranean chicken. You know what the server did? She noticed the order was wrong and pre-emptively had the cook make a Mediterranean, then delivered the cheesesteak to our table, free of charge. 

That kept everyone in a good mood so we could enjoy our other pasties and buy a few more Kilt Lifters. Everyone wins.

Note: The lamb vindaloo pasty is very spicy, so be prepared. My girlfriend adored the Lovely Bit A Salmon pasty. And don't skip the garlic fries.

Service ok...  ovens broke, watched people walk out. We already had our orders in so we were stuck.
Food was ok. All the ceiling fans were not working. VERY uncomfortable!

Cornish Pasty is one of my favorite restaurants, and the ambiance is great, whether it's for a quiet lunch or Happy Hour on Friday with the place crowded. The food is always outstanding, and the staff is so chill and laid back.

Try the Chicken Pesto pasty, and the Cinnamon Apple Pasty for dessert. nom nom!

I was invited here for dinner with a couple of gal pals. I really liked the set up here. We opted to sit at the bar and watch them make their magic and interact with the staff whom are all super friendly. They have a wide variety of "pasties" and fit almost any tastebud craving. I opted to try their soup and garlic- jalapeo chips, the soup was rather bland and the chips were cold. My friends really liked their pasties, so I can't comment on them, maybe next time if I return I'll try one and see how they fair.

I can't believe I forgot to review this place after our visit. Wasn't sure what to expect when I took my husband and my mom here as none of us had ever had a pasty before. I think my fear was based more on the hipster/ college pub atmosphere than facing the unknown. Everything we tried was superb. I got the Oggie which was delicious and filling. We ordered the smushed peas which I thought were delectable. I tried whichever pasties my mom and husband ordered which I can't recall but they were all very good. I definitely intend to return.

My mini late night w/ my hubby. Was the best experience that we had there. Our server Jesse was the the best server that we had for the many times we came. Food is delish.  Tonight we had something different, the salmon salad. Normally I'm not a fan of salad, but I think next time i gotta have it again. I always come for the mushroom, walnut and spinach soup every time. It's a gotta have for me and so is the  car bombs, but tonight I'm addicted to the body bomb. It's lighter in taste. It's perfect!  It's not as rich as the orig. car bomb. Thanks Jesse for the recommendation.

As much as I love CPC, I can't bump it up to 5-stars. I went with a fair group of friends Monday night and expected it to be busy and came to terms that we'd probably have to sit on the patio. Suprisingly, all of the booths on the patio were available because they were SOAKED by the misters. So we ended up having to wait about 20-minutes outside by the available booths because they were unusable :( But the experience inside was stellar as usual.

The menu needs to have a lunch portion size as well as just a plain Lunch menu.  Food is awesome but a bit speedy for lunch here.  It's food is awesome and beer is worth the stop for dining in and dinner mostly.  Can get a little busy on a Friday, Saturday evening so plan ahead.
I visited this establishment last night and was so overly impressed by the food, staff,  and atmosphere.   I highly recommend and can hardly wait to go back.

Not sure why i am giving them a review.  looks like they have plenty of support.  i have had the cajun, and steak and cheese pasty.  both were excellent.  little crowded sometimes.  patience is need here.  it take time to make each pasty, they aren't premade and frozen, so expect to be there a minimum for an hour for luch.  the servers are very nice and polite.  nice to eat something different for a change.  but i will be going back more i am sure.

We've been to the Tempe CPC a lot and just love the huge variety and the friendly staff. We were so excited that a new one opened in Mesa, which is a bit closer to our house. I haven't eaten there yet, but picked up "to go" twice. Everyone is so friendly and nice. Each time I've had to wait beyond the 20 minutes I was told, but each time my order is spot-on, hot and tasty. Now with the new bar in we're looking forward to coming in for a pint and a pasty.
